Reviews.Title: “A Terrific View”
Reviews.Author: Michelle F
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellent service, lovely view-and all for a reasonable price. My son and I loved our stay at the Sebel Pier One, and I will definately be bringing the whole family back.

Reviews.Title: “Position and Price”
Reviews.Author: mtpearl
Reviews.Content: There is nothing like staying in Sydney on the water and under the bridge - the most famous Sydney Harbour Bridge. Sebel Pier One is where you want to be. It is a converted wharf on the waters edge a stones throw from the oldest part of Sydney, the Rocks. A short walk one way takes in the sites of circular quay or the other darling Harbour . If you feel especially fit walk all the way on the harbours edge to the Opera house and on to the botanical Gardens. On your way back have a wonderful lunch in one of the many restaurants in the Rocks. All this at a fraction of the cost of the Park Hyatt around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Sebel Pier One - a must stay.”
Reviews.Author: Trishbo
Reviews.Content: I booked a nights accommodation at the Sebel Pier One this month, April. It was a gift for my mother who was celebrating her 86th Birthday - a nice bit of mother/daughter time. The service on arrival was excellent with birthday wishes extended together with a room upgrade. Later on having a drink, taking in the spectacular view, the manager approached and also wished my mother a happy day. She was thrilled. Sometimes in busy hotels the personal approach is overlooked but not here. All the staff were friendly, approachable and professional. This is a hotel in a very old wharf in an excellent location. The rooms have apparently been upgraded and were beautiful. Decor minimalistic and clean, comfy beds, quite air con............. don't you just love fresh white linen. Waking to a view of Sydney Harbour is unbeatable as a start to the day and is topped off with a great breakfast, once again with speedy service. I have stayed in many Hotels over the years but this place just makes you want to share your experience with others. Coming to Sydney.................... don't stay anywhere other than Sebel Pier One. It's a guarantee you will have a super stay. Enjoy, Patricia

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding - enjoy a weekend break in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jolovestheweekend
Reviews.Content: We stayed after a theatre production. What a location! Enjoy a stroll along the harbour. The charm of The Rocks area is enchanting. The staff make you feel like regular VIP's. The room service menu is delicious and great value for money. The Harbourside rooms are worth the little extra. We paid a lot less for a large deluxe waterfront room than we usually pay for a tiny Darling Harbour room! Valet parking is a bargain. We'll be visiting there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: Just had a fabulous weekend at the pier one - The location is really something and the room was spotless with a water view of traffic up and down the harbour. We walked under the bridge and around to the quay. It was perfect. The service at the hotel was outstanding - reception quick and easy - the guys put the luggage into the car which gave us more time to soak up the break. Mooched around. Breakfast was hot and arrive on time which was a blessing as we had stuffed around and not made things easy. They rang first up to see what time we wanted to be feed. We'd overlooked that part of the menu They simply couldn't do enough to help out. Would certainly recommend to anyone going to Sydney for Business or Pleasure. And it didn't break the bank- LOL

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyn P
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay with a late checkout.Our king size room was on the ground floor so we could sit outside and watch the world go by on the pier or on the harbour. The facilities were excellent and the breakfast delicious. All staff encountered were friendly and proficient and very helpful......we thoroughly enjoyed our stay Lyn, Long Jetty NSW Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and the staff were exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: kcosta1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for two nights and was impressed! The room was not large but cosy and lovely ambience, had high ceilings. Didnt have that hotel feel at all. Really enjoyed it. The bathroom was very nice and spacious. Very clean. Bed really comfortable, slept very well. Breakfast was good overlooking the water which was a nice way to start the day. Commented to friends and colleagues how wonderful the staff were, their customer service was of a very high standard. Will definitely recommend your hotel to others and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic warehouse feel.”
Reviews.Author: SandyBargara
Reviews.Content: We had a Walsh Bay suite for three adults. It was great. Spacious and light with great views of the harbour. The sofa bed was already made up when we arrived and they were prompt with delivering additional glasses, plates and knives for the cheese platter we brought with us. The room was very comfortable but the bed too hard for me. The decor had a real nautical feel which was very apt. The breakfast had a good selection to choose from. Sadly they couldn't make a decent coffee and it cost an additional $5 each. It is a great location - an easy walk to everything. One drawback was the bar under our window which was very noisy until midnight on the Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: andrea p
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel on our first tript to sydney. We found the service friendly and efficient and the hotel has a lot of character. Our room was waterside which was beautiful, would have been lovely to have a small balcony. Our room was very clean, beautiful high ceilings, classic modern decor and the bathroom was very clean. The location for us was great, easy walk to Circular Quay and Opera house and easy walk into the city. What we loved about this hotel was that you were just minutes away from everything but it was quiet in and around the hotel. Also just a gorgeous view sitting in the hotel lounge or out on the deck for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for harbour waterfront”
Reviews.Author: CJANDLJ1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times and each time really enjoyed it. You MUST pay the extra for a waterside room otherwise you will be looking at the street and rocks behind the hotel. The views of the harbour are towards Walsh Bay so you dont get the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge view but even so its still beautiful. The hotel does have valet parking but it is outside and not undercover. Or you can park on the street but I wouldnt as the parking police can be vicious even on weekends. On one stay we got a family room with a double bed and sofa bed and it had the biggest balcony you could ever dream of with a huge table and chairs. Its the only room with a balcony and we felt so special. I have attempted to get this room each other time but alas never been as lucky. The waterside rooms on the top floor are a bit hard to see the water as it is under the timber work of the eaves, so i would suggest requesting middle or bottom levels. The bottom level opens out onto the wharf. We ate in the restaurant. We arrived late and were going to go to Rockpool but in the end got into Sydney too late. I wished we had've as the restaurant whilst it was OK I wouldnt rave about it. Rockpool would've been nicer but it was a long weekend. The breakfast though was fine and its such a fantastic place to start your day from. It is so relaxing sitting out on the wharf. They even made a decent latte. As some have mentioned the toilets are like an airplane one. Its because the hotel is over the water apparently and something to do with the waste or whatever. Forewarned is forearmed. Didnt bother me as it wasnt that noisy. I could NOT fault the cleanliness of the hotel. The bathroom had a lot of chrome and mirrors and it sparkled even down behind the basin which if you have that much mirrors and chrome everywhere Id imagine it would be a nightmare to keep clean. Such a great spot and a great atmosphere. Not pretentious like so many other Sydney hotels, although some of the guests were, but perhaps they should have checked out and checked into one of the more pretentious hotels where they would have felt more at home!

Reviews.Title: “SYDNEY WITH GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Angusgjpm
Reviews.Content: while in Sydney my partner and I have stayed at this hotel twice recently and have been really pleased with the accommodation, food and service.The position is pretty iconic virtually below the harbour bridge with great views of the water and easy walking distance of the Rocks and Circular Quay area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & original”
Reviews.Author: Virg17
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel perfectly located in the opera area. 10 minutes walking from the Sydney opera & very close from "the rocks". Sydney centre accessible walking. The view is also very nice ! You can have your breakfeast / lunch / dinner with the bay view. Just one thing : the rooms are a little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Sebel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnsimons
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sebel Hotel is breathtaking. It is located beside the Sydney Harbor Bridge with a clear view of the inner harbor. The lobby and bar open up on the dock with ample seating for sight-seeing. It is a short walk under the bridge to the Circular Quay with it's many restaurants and attractions. There is great view of the Sydney Opera House from under the bridge. The best rooms have the harbor view. Less expensive rooms are designed around structural elements of the old warehouse.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Central Location”
Reviews.Author: BeckyD885
Reviews.Content: Completely loved this hotel and they were amazing. We stayed on our arrival to Australia as we were starting our 3 week trip to get married and on arrival which was after 23 hours of travelling from the UK and 9pm in the evening we were greeted with an upgrade to a one bedroom suite, a bottle of sparkling wine and a card from the hotel - which was so lovely. Worth the money and really great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Leonarda P
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel to stay at if you want a relaxing time in the city. From the moment you arrive at the front entry your car door is opened for you with a smile. The staff at the reception are courteous, professional and go out of their way to please. The rooms are pleasant & maintained clean with a great view. The whole experience is so relaxing and memorable. The location of the hotel is terrific as you are so close to everything but a million miles away in an absolute heaven. The buffet breakfast is great and again found the staff attentive and friendly. Would definitely consider returning again and commend again the staff for their fantastic service in making our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but not peaceful”
Reviews.Author: maplebjb
Reviews.Content: Staff were good, I think any issues experienced by previous travellers has been sorted out now and they were all helpful. It was a nice area, in the Rocks, walking distance to Circular Quay and slap bang next to the Harbour Bridge. There are some issues, yes the toilet is a concern, the noise didn't bother me but flushing doesn't flush everything well (not nice). The only real bug-bear I had was the wedding receptions going on across at the other pier. Although the room has thick glass doors even they couldn't handle the live band noise, so despite being super tired, we couldn't get to sleep till that was all over and done with. would I stay here again? Maybe mid week. But not that sure it is the best value for money and at the price of the breakfast, I really expected more

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night bliss”
Reviews.Author: ReneeAbroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Walsh Bay Suite the night before and of my wedding. The room was beautiful- the furnishings and overall style of the room are very current and perfect for pre wedding photos as they are so simple and soft. The suite was also well sized which enabled a number of us to get ready without feeling too cramped and restricted. The lighting for the room was also great- there are so many city based hotels that can be very dim and drab feeling- the Sebel definitely isn't one! The overall service we received was also fabulous- concierge were very helpful with our requests- as we had quite a few! nothing was ever a problem. Room service was also a pleasant suprise- we have breakfast in the room both mornings and the meals were as good as if you were eating in the restaurant- i find room service can often being a lesser standard but this wasn't the case. Many people have commented on the noise of the toilet flush but this simply gave us something to laugh about as it did sound like someone was being sucked down it- but this is the only downside we faced. The bathroom was also huge with beautiful fittings and sparkly clean. For out-of-towners the Sebel Pier One is a beautiful hotel located in the most amazing part of the city- there are some great restaurants within walking distance and nothing beats an early morning walk under the harbour bridge around to the opera house. It was a very special stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PNas
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff and awesome breakfast. Rooms are nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lisahart15
Reviews.Content: the service was excellent. all staff were friendly. concierge were great, esp matt. good central location. try the great coffee shop next to the city cycle hire (pier "4" Hickson Rd). gotta do the bridge climb. dinner at aria very nice.

Reviews.Title: “On a wet weekend in Sydney......”
Reviews.Author: denise226
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the front door I felt relaxed. Staff were friendly and it really was service with a smile. Our room was a waterside king which was perfectly adequate and comfortable. Didn't find the high tech toilet a bother like some other reviewers. Loved the comfortable bathroom flooring though! The weather was miserable so I did spend most of my stay reading near the window and watching the amazing amount of boats and ferries pass by! I did not investigate the gym - thought about it but not this weekend! The proximity to the Rocks and the markets is fantastic and an easy walk uphill (and an even easier walk back!) We ate in the Front Restaurant on the Saturday night and the food and service was excellent. Servings were a good size and I was impressed. We weren't hurried and enjoyed our experience. The only downside was the appalling coffee from the self serve coffee machine at breakfast. Given the cost of the breakfast I should not have had to pay an extra $4 to get a very good cup of coffee from the bar. Overall, however, I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: BrownHaskell
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Very nice rooms with great views even if you are not on the harbor side. Very short walk to anything you want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: mum06
Reviews.Content: I organised a surprise stay here for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived at 10.30am after arriving in at 8.30am. We were not able to check in until 2.00pm. We were going to ask if we could leave our luggage at the hotel so we could do some shopping. They were very kind and let us check in early as our room was ready. We were very thankful. We found the staff to be very helpful and obliging. The restaurant food was just superb. The toilets have been mentioned alot in other reviews. They sound like a toilet on an airplane. The are loud but they didnt bother us. We didnt hear other patrons using theirs. We were told the hotel has a particular type of system installed because they are over water. We loved our room, a Waterside King. There was no road noise. It was quiet and peaceful and very relaxing. The sliding door opens up to a rail with a very small concrete slab...not a deck but it was very nice to be able to open the door and look out to the water. We will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Julie Y
Reviews.Content: Decided on Sebel Pier One as we were meeting family arriving home from a cruise. We drove right to the front door, the car was whisked away to parking and luggage carried to reception. One of the most prompt check-in's we've ever experienced. We chose a heritage room which was superb, snug, cosy with a view of the harbour bridge and harbour. Spent the evening wining and dining on the wharf overlooking Walsh Bay. Our stay was one of the most relaxing overnight stays in Sydney for a long time. Thanks to Sebel Pier One.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for being on the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TazzyPerth
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we had stayed here and we would definitely stay again. It is in a great locations in the shadows of the Harbor Bridge jutting out into the water and only a short walk to Circular Quay. The rooms are of good size with a beautiful view of the harbor. The staff are friendly and helpful as well. I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Akshunjase
Reviews.Content: Sebel Pier One was my place of choice to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was a complete disappointment. The Concierge was atrocious. To gain his attention I said "excuse me' and promptly received the reply of "what?" The reception staff seemed too tired to care about checking us in, with no smile, and very little courtesy. The cleaning staff walking into our room after one knock on the door didn't make matters any better. As polar opposite the Room Service staff were lovely. They were happy, friendly and very prompt with our in room dining. Why aren't these people at reception?! I think the reception and concierge staff could take a lesson. The location and view were just gorgeous, however, it certainly wasn't enough to make us want to go back. Next time the Park Hyatt, which is just a few doors away, will recieve our custom and they have a much better view of the harbourside and opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Always nice to return”
Reviews.Author: GuitarmanBowral
Reviews.Content: Have stayed hare many times on business and leisure. Always loved the fabulous position. Is worth paying more for the waterside rooms. Service is friendly and breakfast is great. Due to being an old wool store or similar in its distant past, the hotel has a lot of character. The Sebel Pier One is probably my favourite hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and average presentation for the price”
Reviews.Author: Melinda T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, but is very much 'hotel chain' in presentation. Would look for something more boutique next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: ozgypsy
Reviews.Content: The position is what makes this hotel. The rooms are okay...the bed was good, the water pressure just alright, the service okay. We were fortunate enough to get a room with a large window and although we looked into the back of another pier building across a small stretch of water, it was better than those other people who complained about windows too high to see from. The cable broadband didn't work well and after a frustrating half an hour, just asked for a refund. Back to the position....downstairs is gorgeous on a good day. Wide doors slide open to outdoor eating and drinking areas which are fantastic. As for the noisy plumbing.... well, this is our second stay here. During the first stay we were kept awake by the bangs and whooshes that the plumbing made (coming from other rooms). That was a couple of years ago. We haven't had the same problem this time, but suspect it is because we on on the top floor. The service around the hotel generally seems to be better than our last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Despite its best efforts, it could not ruin our first night of marriage”
Reviews.Author: Nadia_Alex_Latti
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its location, being a few steps from our reception venue. It also looked nice from the outside, and had the feature of being heritage listed. We even 'splurged' and got the honeymoon package, which basically gave us a later check-out time, 4 truffles and some bulgari soaps boxed up, a bottle of Chandon sparkling, and a breakfast (which they later tried to charge us for). The toilet noise issue that has been mentioned in other reviews was not that big of a deal for us, and became something we joked about instead. The problem with this hotel was that there was absolutely no warmth about the place - from the staff or the services provided. We paid a lot of money but felt we did not get much for it. The room itself was small, the bathroom felt flimsy, dark and cheap. There was no recognition that it was our wedding night (despite turning up in our wedding clothes!) aside from the assorted extras which had been dumped in our room hours earlier (the ice around the bottle had long turned into room-temperature water in an ice bucket). We live in Sydney, so we don't know how much that kind of money usually buys in Sydney hotels, but even so, we felt we were staying at an anonymous business hotel - and we were not expecting to stay at a business hotel on our first night of marriage. Also, there is a credit card surcharge, which has been mentioned in other reviews but it just adds insult to injury since this is a hotel in Sydney CBD, where one does not expect that kind of surcharge anymore.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: WyeRiver
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel and it wont be the last. Took the family to Sydney for the weekend along with 60 clients and this place delivered on all fronts. Staff were great, service was exceptional, rooms have everything you need in a hotel room, views from the harbour rooms are great, bar area and restaurant are so giood you dont want to leave and see what else is on offer in the Rocks precinct. It is wedding central though when it comes to hotels/venue so be prepared to share your space with brides and grooms and their entourages. Great location and waljing distance to all the Sydney Icons and if you dont want to walk a water taxi will pick you up at the bar and drop you anywhere. This place wont let you down be it a business or leisure trip. A far more personable experience than any of the other Rock properties.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with personality (and a view!)”
Reviews.Author: Frog_Singap
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to proximity of my office there, 5mins on foot. I feel it's more a leisure hotel than business like Sheraton, Westin or Marriott, so there is a good mix of crowd, and weddings going on on week ends. Highlight is location, under Harbour bridge nearby marina, 5mins pleasant walk to Circular Quay. There is small gym, more a workout room. But, running before work around Opera House and botanical garden, no need a gym, that was awsome ! The lobby and restaurant windows are open (this is summer) on the peer, great ! My room was 3rd floor, overlooking harbour, very nice and minismalist design, all cream and white with a beam and a reverse-V shape high ceiling. The building used to be a warehouse of some sort, so there are beams and pillars that gives it an industrial feel that I like, the building has "personality", unlike boring usual business hotels. Room is well appointed, iPod-compatible radio clock, flat screen, all usual amenities. Unlike mentioned in another comment read here, internet (broadband, no wifi in rooms) is free - if you join the fidelity program (for free). Very efficient and friendly service, knowledgeable concierge team. As also mentioned in another post here, the toilets can be noisy at times. Toilet "technology" is not the usual one, it's like toilets on a plane, so can be a bit noisy indeed, but no worry overall (and cannot hear toilets from other rooms). As a summary, I enjoyed my stay very much and would return. Only downside is the TV: no BBC, no CNN, no HBO, no international channels... only Murdoch crapy Fox news ! However, in the middle of Republican caucuses, interesting to watch super-right wingers Fox news and anchors ;)

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Milly B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms - really big! Comfortable bed and nice big bathroom. Toilets are really noisy though, so make sure you don't flush in the middle of the night!

Reviews.Title: “Was a good time and good location”
Reviews.Author: Fran I
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. I think that the staff have been well trained and they seem to be able to do lots of different things in the hotel which means they are really ready to answer your questions. The location was good and the places to eat around the hotel were also good quality. We will go back when we are in sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible service all around...”
Reviews.Author: ditdit6
Reviews.Content: Held a business function here last year and never saw any member of the function staff the whole time. Service staff were quite disorganised and the function room allocated wasn't even up to par (ie, sound system poor, lighting wasn't great, etc). It seemed that the hotel was only relying on it's great location and harbour bridge view to get customers through the door which is very unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AgentBear
Reviews.Content: The Sebel Pier One is in one of the best spots in the whole of Sydney, right on the harbour next to the iconic bridge. Although the rooms are minimalist they are very well done and very comfortable. It is only a 5 minute walk to the rocks but for a quiet drink the hotel's own bar was very reasonable and it was nice to sit by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rocks location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingjen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sebel Pier One for 2 nights over a weekend. The staff were friendly. The location is great - directly under the Harbour Bridge, very well located if you want to see the major sights on foot. Also a great place to stay to be near the Rocks. It is a short walk to Circular Quay/the Rocks (5mins) and about 10mins to the Opera House. I also walked to the Pitt St Mall daily and that was an easy stroll, though probably 20-25mins. The hotel was fine. I saw the reviews about the toilets on here, and I'm not a very fussy traveller, preferring to find a great deal. For me, the bathroom looked stunning, but there was a lot of noise. The toilets flushing didn't bother me nearly as much as the pipes groaning while in the shower. It is a cute old building so that's fine, but it didn't make me think of five star luxury. The rooms were spotlessly clean. They were small but well laid out. They didn't have a lot of natural light and you couldn't open a window which is a shame. Again - old building. It is nice to stay somewhere with a bit of character rather than a 70s style brick hotel with classic hotel colour scheme - but I probably couldn't stay for more than 2 nights in a place like this. Beds and pillows and room service and amenities all excellent. I slept well though the twin beds were pretty small. This is fine for a quick trip to Sydney. If you are only there a matter of days and want to see a lot and stay in a hotel, reasonably priced , I think it is great. I probably won't stay there again as I have been to Sydney a number of times, and there are so many options I try and stay somewhere near whatever area I want to see. But if you are looking for a place in this location and the price is right, I think you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated - no view of icons - don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Dec 2010 before a cruise. The room wasn't ready when I got there and I was made to wait an hour. (did give my daughters and I a drink in the bar) Sadly the room was well poor value. Basic and overrated. The window in the room was so far up the wall I couldn't see the 'view' - which was a dead body of water. I'll never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, interesting rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Dbth2
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel and wonderful location. Service is acceptable without knocking your socks off. Rooms are interesting. Thoughtfully decorated, akin to a stylish boutique hotel. Bathroom certainly has the wow factor, with floor to ceiling mirror and those roilets. Negatives were lack of natural light and small window ( think building is heritage so limited in adjustment that can be made). That said the view out the window was part of the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TwoJaysonHolidays
Reviews.Content: Decided last minute to take a nights break to coincide with family returning from a cruise. Decided that the Sebel had the best deal and location to watch the ship arrive in the early wee morning hours. As we had driven we needed parking - no problem. Were met on arrival, valet whisked car away and checkin was one of the most prompt and pain free experiences weve had for a while. We had booked a Heritage Room...standard, the room was immaculately presented in every detail. Decor was fitting to the heritage of the bulding...spent the afternoon evening enjoying cold beer & nibbles watching the harbour life at the Front Bar. Then had dinner at the Front Restaurant - meal and wine was "yum". Collapsed in our bed had a great sleep, car was waiting our collection,out front,as arranged after checkout... a totally relaxing break from our hum drum... thanks to Sebel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic waterfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyn C
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Sydney and stayed at the Sebel really comfortable beds good size rooms, the only negative being there is not a lot of natural light which does make them a little claustrophobic but do have great air conditioning the front ones do let in more light but they are all extremely quiet. The breakfast was probably one of the best I've had the dinner was excellent and overall the staff were above average friendly and helpful in particular the restaurant manager. Probably not ideal for children but fantastic for anyone else, walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but noisy toilets!”
Reviews.Author: Tistybus
Reviews.Content: I know, it's a weird title, but I could not get over the noisy toilets! They're like airplane toilets and suck the "stuff" out to save water. Great idea in theory, but that's pretty much all I heard from neighbouring rooms! Otherwise I would have given the Sebel a 4 rating. It's in a lovely location on the harbour tucked just next to the harbour bridge. This side of the Rocks is very quiet and the view over the water is calming. The decor is modern with a nautical twist but not done in a tacky way. The bed was very comfortable and the toiletries were great. If you want to be near the Rocks and within 10-20 mins walk of the Opera House and Circular Quay, this is an excellent choice! Other hotels in the area are very pricey, but this one offers some good deals because it's just a few minutes more to walk. Very much worth it. Staff are lovely and cheerful. If only it weren't for those toilets!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and the city”
Reviews.Author: joelenegoesonline
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 days at Pier One and I was truly thrilled. I general have problems sleeping in hotel rooms as I miss the creature comforts of home. But I can honestly say, I've never slept so well. My bed was wonderfully comfy and the pillows were magic. I noticed they have a pillow menu from which you can select your preferred type but found the stnadard one perfectly suitable. I loved the location. I walked into the business district each day (about 1km away) and really enjoyed walking home seeing the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and Luna Park each day. I was surprised that such a central location was so tranquil. The room was pleasant, I had a Walsh Bay king room and found this to be ideal for my stay. I loved that this is a heritage building so for me it had character. The toilets are vacuum flushed, which is noisey but I didn't mind it too much. If anything I like knowing that my hotel put such importance on environmental sustainability. Breakfast was lovely each day and my room was always spotless. Staff were friendly and proficient. They even helped my husband to organize flowers as a surprise for me while I was out. I will be traveling to Sydney regularly for the next 2 years and I think I've found my hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - yet so close to the Rocks and Sydney CBD.”
Reviews.Author: pamlSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed just the one night at The Sebel yet the position of the hotel right on Sydney Harbour meant we could just relax and enjoy a wine or meal and just watch the ferries and boats sail by. The location is within walking distance of The Rocks area where we enjoyed exploring this historic part of Sydney including the wonderful old pubs and then on the Saturday ambled around the Rocks Markets. The location is also an easy walk to both Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House. The room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the water and was stylish and modern. Breakfast out on the terrace was plentiful with a wonderful variety of fresh fruits, cereals and ample hot food which was constantly refilled. This was our second stay at this Hotel and it won't be our last....why stay in the hussle and bussle in the heart of the City when you can have such a relaxing holiday 5 mins down the road and with the water nibbling at your feet. The Sebel gets our vote.

Reviews.Title: “A nice spot away from the rush”
Reviews.Author: Haz89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family as we had a graduation for my fiance to attend in the city.. The hotel is unique and well presented. This was the my fourth stay at the and the room we stayed in was newly renovated. The room was nicely appointed and I like the new look. The food in the restaurant has always been good and service has always been friendly. I have enjoyed every stay at this property and will be back for many stays in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: What a great property. Super close to the Rocks but facing west for the afternoon sun and sunset. Great harbour activity because it's beside the bridge. Above all was the service... friendly and helpful. Especially the door + concierge... they were more than exceptional... bar none the finest I've had in recent memory. TIPS : if you can upgrade to the king rooms water facing. The 2nd floor has doors that open to the water. Plan to sit in the lobby bar and waterfront patio. Negative... the food menu in the bar is really poor... they could do much better given that the breakfast buffet was really good. The bed was amazingly comfy.. we slept like babies every night. The room was modern with electric blinds... not important but very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary - have a look first!”
Reviews.Author: Gibble1979
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay here. The location is very good - close to Circular Quay and the city without being too close to the crowds - it's a much more relaxing location and the views really are fantastic over the water and up toward the bridge. My room was a rear facing heritage and was extremely nice - very stylishly furnished and easily worth the star rating. I did though have a nice high ceiling which my colleagues room did not, and this definitely made my room far nicer despite the cost being the same. Worth checking therefore....! Bathrooms had the vaccuum flush which has been mostly criticized. I didn't personally find it an issue but maybe you would if you were a light sleeper. Other than that the bathroom was very nice and spacious. The bar had a good selection of drinks and was a good spot to hang out by the water in good weather, although bear in mind they have a lot of weddings here so you may hear the discos etc ongoing. Restaurant food was very good if pricey, and the breakfasts were good too (if it's bad weather though it's a bit of a squeeze if the hotel is full). It's a short walk up the steps opposite the hotel to the Rocks where there are plenty of bar and restaurant options (so long as you don't mind the climb!!), and overall I would be happy to stay here again - it's a very fresh feeling hotel and you really don't feel like you're in the centre of a bustling city. One star knocked off for a couple of minor issues - I didn't receive a call when my room was ready and a couple of staff seemed slightly undertrained on occasion (didn't know the drinks they had etc), but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: LeanneB73
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant stay in a wonderful hotel. Check in was quick, conceirge was extremely helpful, wonderful location and exceptionally presented rooms. This hotel is in a brilliant location to see all the wonderful sights of the harbour city. You are literally at the steps to the Harbour Bridge and a leisurely stroll from The Opera House. Luna Park is across the river and harbour cruises are close by. Great restaurants nearby (try Firefly Wine and Tapas Bar). Brilliant location and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Michele C
Reviews.Content: Amazing! great harbour views, relaxing and quiet. Staff very friendly and helpful, accomodation brilliant, comfy bed and pillows, extremely clean and decor beautiful. Have stayed here on 3 occasions now and would definately stay again. Continental breakfast was lovely, beautiful food to cater for all tastes , lovely atmosphere! The out side pier was an amazing place to have a drink, watch the boats go by and relax. Thank again for making our wedding anniversary special with the complimentary Chandon....chilled.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the only place to stay in Sydney - totally magic.”
Reviews.Author: karen h
Reviews.Content: There's a famous quote about a french champagne - "I drink it when I'm happy and when I'm sad Sometimes I drink it when I'm alone When I have company I consider it obligatory..." Sebel Pier 1 is like that for me - it is the only place I want to stay in Sydney - for business, for romance, for that special close family time - as we did this New Year. We decided to escape the normal madness and spend time with our 21 year old daughter and her partner- for view and ambience where else to go but Pier 1? To all of the staff who were so friendly and helpful -thank you; To Allan, duty manager and Blake, concierge-thank you for the extra touch of care; you made our time there totally wonderful and will always be remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: Staying at this location over New Years Eve was excellent, hotel is positioned right under the Harbour Bridge. The staff were very obliging and accommodating. Our memorable New Years Eve was made so enjoyable by the staff that night who could not do enough, including the drinks after the midnight firework display in the lounge/bar. Our 4 day stay was excellent from the moment we walked in the foyer until we departed. Rooms were clean and well equipped. An extremely pleasant stay - thoroughly recommend Sebel for a true resort style accommodation in Sydney Rocks area,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year dinner”
Reviews.Author: davidhartman
Reviews.Content: I took my wife, daughter and her boyfriend to the Front Restaurant for the New Year's Eve dinner, which was a six course degustation menu: (1) heirloom tomato terrine with fennel pollen sorbet (!), (2) oyster prawn and scallop 'taste of the sea', (3) wagyu rib fillet with truffled potato, (4) barramundi with dashi broth and wakame, (5) bombe alaska with berries, (6) cheese plate. Front Restaurant doesn't seem to have much of a reputation -- but this was seriously good food! The wagyu with truffled potato mash was one of the yummiest things I have ever eaten -- I actually moaned aloud from pleasure. Staff were friendly and efficient, the wine flowed freely, we had a great view of the fireworks, and the evening was a total success. Expensive, yes, but hey this is NYE in Sydney, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from this highly overrated hotel. Reception: 1 out of 5. The girls did not appear to have been sufficiently trained. Too bad. Bathroom: 2.5 out of 5. Too small and stuffy. The toilet flushIng noise was simply deafening which prevented us from using it at night for fear of waking up the kids. Overall decor: it looks more like a hospital then a warehouse.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: WaterArt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a renovated pier and the rooms have the slight quirkiness of working around pillars and posts which I find charming. It's location is unbeatable - walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, the Opera House, Wharf Theatres, Sydney Theatre - and to sit outside either for breakfast or a post-show drink watching the water glisten is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ckAthens
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Sebel Pier One, Sydney. The hotel, which is very conveniently located, practically under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and only a short walk away from the Rocks, is quite good although quite pricey. Our room was wonderfully decorated, but was only a touch larger than a matchbox, enjoying the dull view of the back street (instead of a harbor view). The Hotelâ€™s restaurant was excellent, both in terms of meal quality and service, although that too, was quite expensive compared to equivalent European standards. In any case, I do suggest this hotel; just make sure your luggage is not big enough for your room size. Alternatively do find the energy (perhaps after a 20hr flight to Syd) to ask the reception to move you to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location right next to the Bridge!”
Reviews.Author: Shazmoz8031
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice and the location is just wonderful. The Sebel Pier One is built out on to the water near warehouses right under the Sydney Harbour Bridge, so you're right in with the action. It is 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay, and only 5 minutes by taxi to Darling Harbour. We chose a King Water View room, and although there is a sliding door you can open out onto the water view, there isn't much of a balcony, but the fresh air is wonderful. We saw a couple of cruise ships sail under the Sydney Harbour Bridge so we really were that close! We also chose to do the BridgeClimb, so we walked right there. All in all, an amazing stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dani_from_west_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We chose a basic room without water views as we weren't going to be spending much time in our room. We flew into Sydney at 7am and went straight to the hotel to drop our bags off, the reception said they would call us once our room was ready and they called us at 11am to inform us we could now check in which was great. The service was friendly and our room was very nice. We ate breakfast at the hotel on one occasion and it was of the usual standard for a hotel buffet breakfast, as was the room service. The bar is great and the alfresco area on the water is lovely with beautiful views. The hotel is in a great location walking distance to the opera house and city centre. I am happy with my choice to stay at this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except....”
Reviews.Author: Flojo93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sebel Pier One for three nights two weeks ago before flying on to New Zealand for a bike tour around the south island. We thought everything about the hotel was perfect except for one thing. The location can't be beat (right under the Harbour Bridge... minutes walk to Circular Quay, Opera House, Royal Botanic Gardens, etc.), the room was large even by American standards, the included buffet breakfast was delicious and plentiful with the bonus of enjoying it overlooking the bay, and the concierge recommended an excellent restaurant for our first night's dinner. The only negative is that they charge an arm and a leg for internet access. Maybe they're trying to capitalize on business travelers on expense accounts, but in this day and age, what's the big deal about providing free wifi? I would have given 5 stars but for this.

Reviews.Title: “Lying in bed underneath the Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: crazisheep
Reviews.Content: Waking up in the morning and staring up at the bridge isnt a sight you get at very many hotels in Sydney. This hotel appears to be slightly out of the way as its on the back side of the bridge..dont be fooled..within 10/15 minutes youre smack bang in the centre of the Rocks/Circular Quay/Opera house area! Its great..breakfast on its own pier in the sunshine was fantastic. The rooms have all been refurbished, our ground floor room still had the warehouse feel with great high ceilings. Definitely no complaints here, and can recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite”
Reviews.Author: perthtravellor
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Sebel, a long weekend in Sydney to enjoy culture and dining The room, a Walsh Bay suite, was lovely and roomy with a terrific bathroom and good amenities. But, the tv was difficult to use and the coffee was not replenished all weekend. The breakfast was very ordinary, dreadful coffee and dirty tables, rushed, noisy and not at all relaxing. The wrong newspaper was delivered to us on Saturday and no paper at all on Sunday. Given the price, they could get this right. I was disappointed by young Blake on the concierge desk who was rude, twice, once on the phone and once in person mate, you are the first port of call, learn some customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: valleyprince55
Reviews.Content: After a weekend on a Royal Carribean Cruise the girls and I walked from the overseas passenger terminal to Sebel Pier One... What a delight it was to walk in and be greeted by fantastic staff only to willing to help us with an early check in and bag storage. The rooms were far nicer than the pictures and far roomier. We had 3 ladies staying in a Deluxe Heritage room with the sofa bed folded out and had plenty of room for our luggage and all things girly... Very happy with our choice of hotel and nice and close to various bars and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joyandgraham
Reviews.Content: Perfect location being a pleasant walk from Opera House, Circular Quay (trains and ferrys) and Rocks area. Hotel very comfortable, limited views on bridge side, but our room had lovely outlook over parkland and bridge. Staff were all without exception, friendly ,knowledgable and helpful. Restaurant with excellent food, front bar had lovely views, sitting out on the pier with a drink looking over Walsh Bay was a very pleasant way to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Sebel twice now and we are never disappointed. Great service, great rooms and a grreat view.

Reviews.Title: “Schoene Lage”
Reviews.Author: axel912
Reviews.Content: Sehr schoenes Hotel in toller Lage. Leider kein Pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: daddymike
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a King Heritage room which was rather small and dark as it was at the side of the bridge with no paricular view only a brick pillar and iron work. Rather expensive for room only. Front bar and bistro had excellent views across the harbour and good views of the bridge. Seems to be an hotel that concentrates mainly on weddings. There were numerous ones over the weekend we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but typical Australian service.”
Reviews.Author: dennis0111
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 11/11 - 13/11. I chose this hotel to stay to celebrate my proposal to my girlfriend - now fiancÃ©e. I booked the room a couple months in advance, i requested if something could be done, i wasn't fishing for an upgrade , even just a congratulations card , a bottle of wine. But in typical Australian fashion (I live in Melbourne and try not to travel around Australia because of this) they said nothing could be done. I wasn't going to beg but i chose to stay because of the location. When we checked in the room wasn't ready, the hotel advised they will call when its ready. 4 hours later and no call , we happened to make our way back after a walk and lunch and i brought the point up to reception who apologised. Typical. The housekeeping was great, great room , comfortable bed, great facilities in the room. Though both nights the hotel had functions in which we had a waterside room and the bars were open and people could talk/yell right below us. Hard to sleep. For the price of the hotel, i wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, not so perfect service or facilities”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideAussie23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the waterfront and practically right under the Harbour Bridge. Location could not be faulted. However I think that the service, room, facilities were ordinary and not worth the price I paid for the couple of nights that I stayed there. I stayed in the hotel on a Friday and Saturday night and both nights there were wedding receptions in the hotel which meant that the noise didn't subside until 12:30-1:00am and affected my sleep. I was also annoyed when I asked for an additional blanket and a single bed blanket was delivered to me - for a king size bed!! I would only stay there again if I got the room for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Close to bridge”
Reviews.Author: jjpm
Reviews.Content: Good location close to bridge easy walk to Quay and town. Good size room very quiet considering how close to the brige this place is. Not quite harbour views from our room had to stand on tip toe the window was high. The staff were helpful a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & views”
Reviews.Author: aatrip08
Reviews.Content: Having not stayed here for around 8 years it was a nice suprise when we arrived on a sunday evening to find the hotel in such a modern, trendy condition. Our check -in was quick and the foyer is spacious with great views out to the harbour. We had a Waterside King Room. The king bed was very comfortable, the room modern & fresh and a sliding door which opens out to the harbour. The bathroom was also modern & clean, and as other reviewers have stated it has a very loud toilet flush! Being the day after our wedding and having an early flight the following morning, we opted instead of dining out to order in. We weren't disapointed. The room service menu has lots of variety and our meals were delicious. All round, we would consider this hotel again if we were after a quiter stay in Sydney away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Great quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Pier access from room”
Reviews.Author: NationalHoliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times in ground floor, pet-friendly room. Room is clean and nicely furnished, but nothing extra special except the location. A bit dark until the western sun comes in. Best part is access from room directly on to the Pier. But this can also be a nuisance if you are non-smoker, as the pier is the smoking area. Upper floor rooms are small, with small windows. This is because it is a historic building site, so existing timbers remain, and are in front of windows. The staff did not understand at all about the difference between a pet dog and an assistance dog; this always causes difficulty for people with disability or people training an assistance dog. As far as pet-friendly, itâ€™s not that friendly. Would strongly recommend Hughenden Boutique Hotel for pet-friendly. Initially there were pet beds, a bowl and a dog toy provided in the pet rooms, but last stay there was nothing. Restaurant was understaffed, bar area is friendly, especially â€˜after workâ€™ hours. Front desk and concierge good. Room service food is good. Book ahead for parking as it is limited, and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaB2008
Reviews.Content: Great location at a good price - check out prices on Qantas website for special offers, cheaper than at Trailfinders where we booked the flights. Loved the quirky nature of the place - glass floor in lobby, signed paving outside the bar, great rooms showing the original beams and windows. Comfy bed, good bathroom, nice bar. Staff were great, especially the porters - they're into English football too! We had a room on the front with an excellent view of the Harbour Bridge - surreal, especially watching the 'bridgeclimbers'. I like the more unusual hotels that aren't umpteen stories high, so this fitted the bill perfectly - just a couple of floors and a bit unusual, great. Very well positioned, handy for the Opera House and Circular Quay and the ferries, not to mention the Bridgeclimb, which I totally recommend - easy, not scary and worth the view from the top! Don't think about it just do it! Catch the ferry to Watson's Bay and walk around to the headland by the lighthouse, worth it to see the entrance to Sydney Harbour. Watson's Bay has a great fish and chip takeaway or you could go to the restaurant if you'd rather sit down - both called Doyles. Watch out for the nudist beach around the corner!!! A ferry trip to Manly is a must, head down the Corso and round to Shell Bay, a gentle walk. Or catch the bus to Bondi and walk around the rocky headland. Loads of trips and things to do in and around Sydney, spoilt for choice really.

Reviews.Title: “sebel pier one”
Reviews.Author: jarthurMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. The rooms are cosy, warm and inviting and bed large and very comfortable. The bathroom is well fitted out. The accommodation is first rate. The lobby is lightfilled and opens right onto Sydney Harbour! In the lobby floor is a glass view of the Harbour water below. Straight ahead across the Harbour is Luna Park. To the right of the hotel is Sydney Harbour Bridge. A short walk takes you to the Rocks and Darling Harbour and Circular Quay and Sydney CBD. The service is friendly and helpful, A very good choice for top shelf accommodation/location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No Discrimination”
Reviews.Author: mezzashols
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a night in Sydney for our wedding anniversary and got a great deal on Wotif! Despite getting a hot deal of $170/night, on arrival we were upgraded to a King room with harbour views. The bed was sooooo comfy and the room spotless! We enjoyed a few drinks from the bar prior to dinner . The professional service and manner of the staff was exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble. The meals were delicious but if you are a big eater you may feel a little disappointed with the size...however it was perfect for us. Choice for breakfast was plentiful. Location is perfect. Walking distance to the Circular Quay shopping and quaint pubs. Although we arrived on a budget price, we were treated no differently. It has been noted in the media of late that many deals that are offered on-line do not follow-through with customer service but the Sebel did not disappoint. We will be back hopefully before our next anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Our Sydney holiday”
Reviews.Author: sheralee g
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel beautiful rooms and fantastic views very helpful staff so close to shopping, resturants, markets and Sydney Harbour Bridge the bridge climb is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, funky and in a perfect position. Had a bit of trouble with the exhaust fan in the bathroom, handled well by the duty manager Dave, Thanks Dave. Bed fabulous, staff greal over all you will not be disappointed ig you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shortblack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after a show at the nearby Sydney Theatre. The room appeared to be newly renovated and was excellent. I would have liked to have an open window or door. Comments here about the vacuum toilets are correct they are a bit alarming. Harbour-side room was supremely quiet, ours was at the south end of the corridor while the view was pleasant I would have preferred one at the other (northern) where the outlook is more appealing. We only had breakfast in the hotel and it was fair value, we had to specifically request eggs cooked to order and the barista coffee was cold and charged separately. Probably best to stick to the cheaper continental option which was generous. Valet parking was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our brief stay.”
Reviews.Author: Childs
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms last Saturday both facing the bridge and Opera House. While the weather wasnt kind to us the overall experience was excellent. We were going to a wedding at the nearby Simmer On The Bay and walked from the hotel. I also got the rooms on a special from Sydney Weekender for $249 with Breakfast and a bottle of champage which I thought was an excellent special. Breakfast was made even better with Henry Winkler(the fonz) sitting at the next table. Room was large and the bathroom very clean and overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A real Sydney experience”
Reviews.Author: sunsetdrinks
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Sydney and over the years have stayed at many hotels, but this is one of the best for position, view and comfort, with a price tag less than comparable nearby hotels. Yes, there is no view of the Opera House, but who needs that when you can have a room right on the harbour, with views of passing ships, and you can see the Opera House as soon as you leave the front of the hotel, with Circular Quay only a short walk along the water, under the Sydney Harbour Bridge and past the Overseas Shipping Terminal (have a look at Quay Restaurant there - Australia's No1 restaurant), and the Museum of Contemporary Art. I think it is necessary to have a waterside room or the whole Sydney experience is wasted, but the cheapest waterside room is ample. Not all rooms have windows which open, so ask for one when booking. We have not tried meals apart from breakfast, which is only OK, but since there is nowhere better nearby, it has to do. If you like to be near shops etc, then this place is not for you, but if you like a good five star quality room with harbour views, not very far from the CBD, then I can absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view, average service”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly located at an incredible beautiful spot, just on the harbor, fantastic view (if you get a room overlooking the harbor. Do NOT take a room on the back site of the hotel, you will be veeeery disappointed.). The reception area is very nice and the view from the outdoor bar just breathtaking. What a great place to be, if you want to be a bit off track of the tourist locations. Unfortunately the hotel still needs to optimized the service performance of the personel. But that is a minor problem. I would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: teadybearhammer
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in September. Everything was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good but would not recommend paying the up front price for it. We were offered a $20 per day special and that was more like the value for what was offered. The hotel was nice and quiet and a ten minute stroll to Circular Quay. We have stayed in a number of hotels in this area over the past 3 years and this was the cheapest price we have paid for so far, and was as good as the dearer ones. We have lost our money recently by paying and then cancelling on non-refundable wotif sites. We paid only a few dollars more paying Sebel Pier direct for this stay and had we needed to cancel we would have only lost the first nights accomodation cost. My advice would be to pay them direct if you are going to stay there and ask for a deal on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Return stay even better”
Reviews.Author: SRBarber
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Pier One, had previously stayed in a Waterview Room and requested same for our second visit, we were really pleased to receive a complimentary upgrade to a larger room. A quiet location in an excellent area, that is close to Circular Quay. All staff encountered were friendly and we really enjoyed our stay. Recommend Pier One for visitors who don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of the city area. The beds are so comfortable - we had the best sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: christina k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were very impressed by the professional and friendly attitude of all staff. The location on the harbour is beautiful and very relaxing. At night harbour cruise boats are passing, alight and often with music heard clearly across the water. We sat on the wharf outside the bar enjoying the view and each others company. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - staff are excellent.”
Reviews.Author: dworks10
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and clean and the service was good. While we didn't have a harbour view we did see two weddings having their photos done just outside. The hotel isn't far from the rocks or the harbour - and so we did a little more walking and exploring around out lovely city. Great place to stay for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and definately will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor M
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautifully viewed hotel in sydney so affordable and the breakfast buffet is amazing will be staying there every time we are in sydney! Staff were most friendly at all times!

Reviews.Title: “A gem with a couple of raw edges”
Reviews.Author: pmorg
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here in August 2011, during an unseasonably warm period for winter in Sydney. Good stuff: The location is TOPS - right next to the Sydney Harbour bridge and around the corner from the Sydney Opera House. Here is the view from the end of the pier: http://www.flickr.com/photos/petideuxmont/6051958887/ and a 2 minute walk around the corner: http://www.flickr.com/photos/petideuxmont/6051958891/in/photostream/ Super! We stayed on room # 312 which is a Waterside room, right at the end of the pier on the 3rd floor. It was nicely decorated and a fine size for just a few nights stay. Front of house staff were extremely helpful, nice, and super professional - couldn't fault them. Not so good: I would have preferred a 2nd floor room as our view was partially blocked by wooden slats, and our balcony door didn't open. There were some odd things about the bathroom: no extractor fan, so we had to leave the doors open when we were showering, so that the mirrors weren't completely steamed up afterwards; a very filthy vent in the roof; bubbles from your shower gel would come up through the plug hole in the floor after a shower - which was right where you'd stand in front of the basin - slippery!; not enough towel/bathrobe hooks in the bathroom - but there were 4 over the mirror in the hall space - so hanging your towels would block that mirror (??!!). Pillows were huge! Hard to sleep on. And every morning at around 7.30-7.45am without fail, we'd be woken by the maids chattering loudly in the hall - where the cleaning room was jammed open. Each morning I would stumble out looking deliberately SLEEPY, and grab the newspaper, after which they would quieten down. Breakfast was good, but I'd recommend just going for the continental and not cooked ($10 extra) which wasn't that appealing. Continental was great. Could have done with being offered more coffee. No free wifi. Come on guys it's 2011. Overall: I would still recommend this place to my friends - the 'not so good' stuff is only minor. But book Waterside, and ask for a 2nd level room.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel with staff to match!”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: We keep returning to this hotel when we visit Sydney and it just gets better. The staff here are consistently top performers, extremely professional and knowledgeable - nothing is too much trouble - all services are delivered with a sincere smile and they go the extra mile to ensure your stay meets a very high standard. The facilities are superb, the rooms are always fresh and clean and we always sleep well - despite being a very busy hotel, noise always seems to be at a minimum. It is very handy to everything - we walk into the city centre, to Circular Quay, the Rocks and Darling Harbour and there is a very good deli just down the road! It is our one and only choice for accommodation when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, great location overlooking the water!”
Reviews.Author: lynWollongong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sebel Pier One on 3 August during an overnight business trip to Sydney. The hotel is in a great location right on the water with views towards North Sydney and Luna Park. The location is great, a few minutes by cab to CBD but it is in a quiet location on the water. I stayed in a waterside room which was beautiful, and felt like I was miles away from the hustle & bustle of the city. The recently refurbished room was tastefully & simply decorated with fantastic amenities. The only downside was poor internet access with my 3G toggle, so I had to pay for hotel internet access but this wasn't a major issue as the hotel internet connection was strong, so I could still get my work done. Lovely public bar / lounge area and amazing outdoor terrace which literally sits over the water. Having a glass of wine on the terrace while watching the sunset over the water was an added bonus. Room service meal was very average, but I have eaten in the hotel restaurant in the past and the food was very good. Friendly staff who were willing to accommodate without being intrusive. I love this hotel and will definitely go back, for lesiure and business. I would describe it as an oasis in the City.

Reviews.Title: “what a setting”
Reviews.Author: waterboy2427
Reviews.Content: everything from the moment i arrived was perfect. The view, rooms, location, food and especially the attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel...!”
Reviews.Author: Ozviking1167
Reviews.Content: Location, service, great dining and top notch rooms... All fantastic. After reading some not so complimentary reviews on here (admittedly the bad ones are from 3 to 5 years ago) I was unsure about this hotel. But since their very sophisticated renovation invented to give it a try. I loved it. Charming, historical, modern yet warm. Great dinner in the restaurant and the room was perfect. Slept like a baby in the uber comfortable bed. Great value for money. I booked on their iPhone app and got free buffet breakfast and Internet access. I highly recommend you cone try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.. a must for anyone wanting to stay near The Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: JulesandGarry
Reviews.Content: we planned a trip to The Rocks and the Sebel was a perfect choice with friendly staff and a delicious buffet breakfast. We arrived early and went for a short walk but in no time at all we got a cheerful call to say the room was ready. A lovely weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: LizCo_14
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this Hotel. I was caught in airport and flight closures and was lucky enough to be able to stay at the Sebel Pier One in Sydney whilst trying to get back to Adelaide. The staff were fantastic and supportive from reception to the restaurant. The Hotel was flexible about my booking as it was unclear when I would be leaving. I will defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location, highly recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: mar_lub
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 night stay at the Pier One. The hotel itself is in a great location (the only hotel with a better location would Park Hyatt - currently closed). Walking distance to Opera, Bridge, Zoo, Aquarium, Sky Tower, Fish Market, you name it. Service was very good, we didn't try the restaurant, so can't comment on the food. The room we got was on the first floor, decor is toned with historic elements of the building. If you're concerned with a vacuum hydraulics, don't be - once the bathroom door is closed, we couldn't hear a thing. The bed was brand new, and you get to choose a pillow type! Overall we were quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back. Staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: COLEDAPTO
Reviews.Content: Booking in was swift and presentedn no problems. Our room was excelent with great vievs of the harbour. Easy walking distance to all venues. Food was excelent' although I think they could serve the room service meun in the restaraunt. Overall enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: margnmike
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely room that overlooked the harbour. Everything was just right. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast got a little hectic and food ran out on the hot buffet a couple of times but the overall quality was great. Free wifi available in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to be”
Reviews.Author: AJC001
Reviews.Content: This is just a great place to be in Sydney, even on a wet weekend. The Executive rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Best buffet breakfast (included in the cost) I have had in recent times - I usually avoid them. But it is the friendly service and location that singles it out. Perched on the harbour with the bridge overhanging and circular quay only a short walk away. I'd like to be back there now.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Pandora13
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while beautifully situated, makes you feel ripped off at every turn. I was charged an extra night for checking in after my 24 hour flight at 9:00 in the morning--no warning given. Wi-fi costs $60.00 for three days. Expresso at breakfast is an extra. You are charged 1.5% for paying with a credit card! And it's an expensive hotel to begin with. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark location, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LloydnLaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and 2 friends of ours stayed at the same time; we were in a 2nd floor room, they on the ground floor. Despite being described, when we booked them, in the same way the rooms were quite different. The second floor rooms are longer and more spacious but the "balcony" is just a balustrade to stop you from falling out. On the ground floor the room opens onto the pier itself, so effectively you have a small terrace. Our friends did say it was quite noisy. The rooms are beautiful and feel more boutique than corporate. The TV is a big flat screen, the mini bar good and the beds are superb. Despite comments that I found a little off putting when I was reading about this hotel in trip advisor the bathroom was very clean, odourless and the fact that the toilet is designed to minimise the use of water and makes a surprisingly loud noise ( my wife found that if she put her fingers in her ears the problem disappeared!) it wasn't the disaster that other people found it. Everything else about the hotel was five star, the concierge especially was very helpful. On our last night, due to sheer exhaustion, we ordered room service - both having the home made burger. It was absolutely delicious. The one let down, for us, was the lack of wifi in the room. It's only available in the bar (for a rather expensive fee). There is an old fashioned ethernet cable in the room which was useless for an ipad. We'd definitely stay here again, the location is stunning we felt well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: zinzan66
Reviews.Content: We nearly changed our minds on this hotel after reading the comments on here,glad we didn't,yeah the toilets are a little loud but the rooms and the view and location made up for it,the staff were very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a pass - not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy L
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious but on the ground floor not facing anything scenic at all. Skip the bathroom altogether, the toilet system functions on a vacuum waste system similar to that on an airplanes with one small (glaringly huge) difference. When you flush you have to be prepared to walk away deaf as the resulting noise is not only horrifyingly loud, it goes on for a few good seconds. It got to the point where my partner was afraid to flush in the middle of the night for fear of waking me up. Hotel concierge is a laugh they were the worst I've seen in a long time, completely unhelpful and told us to walk out and look for a restaurant if we were looking for dinner suggestions - In contrast, our next hotel Sheraton on the Park was not only cheaper, the rooms were better (no crazy flushing toilet), and the service was 100 times better than this. Not the best start to our weekend away, so glad we moved the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling stay”
Reviews.Author: Triggersplace
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how bad this hotel was. We waited at the lift for 20 minutes before someone told us that you had to swipe the lift button and not push it. Our room key didn't work. The TV remote didn't work. The bathroom was patched up with silicon (see photo). The balcony was 30 cm deep (see photo). And finally you couldn't sleep because the toilets use a vacuum pump which is so loud that anyone going to the toilet next door or across the hall wakes you up. All night long all I could hear were toilets going off. I complained the next day and even asked for earplugs but was not even offered a different room. I asked for my suit to be dry cleaned but was told to walk a kilometer down the road. The only redeeming thing was a good breakfast. If you don't believe me about the noise from the toilet listen to the video.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good spot.”
Reviews.Author: s_mc500
Reviews.Content: The Pier One is nicely fitted out and rooms with interesting features built in remind you of the location. We found it to be comfortable and staff very helpful . Car parking can be an issue as it is all off site but the concierge looks after it for a fee. Water taxi can pick you up from the hotel which can be nice. The restaurant is accommodating and meals are as good as anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: micjanWollongong
Reviews.Content: booked a waterside room we were given a room with no views our bags were put in the wrong room and left there all day told reception there was only one robe in the room but didnt get another one have stayed here many times before but will not be comming back

Reviews.Title: “Great staff shame about the heritage plumbing”
Reviews.Author: sijelca
Reviews.Content: Staff were v helpful and and did their best trying to support a hotel that suffers quite a bit because of heritage listing. We booked a king delux and the room was very nice. Unfortunately the plumbing, smell in the bathroom, creaking floorboards made getting a good nights sleep pretty challenging even though the bed was very comfortable. We also had challenges accessing the Internet and wondered how a bottle of wine and chocolate bar had been charged to our room but these were refunded when we checked out. Liked the location and the staff but hotel is not good value de money. For the price we paid there are a lot of better hotels in similar area. Wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL IN GREAT HARBOURSIDE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: marigoldKent
Reviews.Content: Just overnight at this Hotel en route to a Cruise from Sydney. Luxurious rooms - well furnished and equipped. Fairly expensive, but for location and 'Sydney Harbour' prices, well within average

Reviews.Title: “Surprise packet”
Reviews.Author: spoons74
Reviews.Content: Looking for an overnight en route home, seven pier one was a good solution. The location is handy, though a little on the outerside of the rocks. Staff were overall good, though not sure they anticipated needs. Tried to have a coffee in the lobby lounge one night and all seemed a little top hard for the staff. Rooms were renovated and although view cost a premium, the industrial bars in the room would have held a karma sutra swing...if only I'd packed one. Coffee was bitter and overpriced on the lobby terrace. Overall a good hotel experience though you wouldn't want to overspend on the room. Try the roof top bar at the glenmore nearby! Love in travel Spoons

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: No hotel in Sydney is going to be cheap over new year period so I am not going to comment on the room rate. As I had also booked my birthday party for 30 people st the hotel I was treated to an upgrade and had the best suite in the hotel which was much appreciated. Shame the only room in the hotel with a balcony was unsafe do we couldn't use it! Great breakfast. Lovely helpful staff. When we had an issue with flights due to trail finders error the reception staff exelled themselves. Fantastic location just under the bridge with great views and a short walk to circular quay and the opera house. Lovely outside deck for drinks and breakfast which was the most memorable setting for a birthday party ever! The food and service for the party was exceptional and good value. Water taxis pick you up from the deck which is great fun. Highly recommended. I travel to Sydney on business frequently and will definitely stay here again as a nice co trash to the business district hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Valet parking, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: smweine
Reviews.Content: From the second we checked in the staff were rude. The car was valeted with out asking or advising us of the cost. Even at check in she seemed vague and still didn't advise how much valet parking was. We were not happy with the room, the pier on ground level that we overlooked was a public walk way we had NO privacy and we needed to keep our blinds closed at all times which was very disappointing. The rooms are lovely, comfortable and elegant. We were picking up family early the following morning from a Cruise and had our room service breakfast order on the door well before the cut off time. The following morning we were up early to ensure we had eaten and we ready to leave. Our breakfast didn't arrive and when we looked the room service order was still hanging on our door! When the hotel was advised they did send up our breakfast complimentary, but we were running extremely late. When they returned the car from Valet parking our after market custom 20 inch rims were damaged and scratched badly. We alerted the hotel manager, who simply told us all he could do was ask the valet!! Of course he denied it and as a result the repair cost us $200. The hotel refunded the cost of valet $35.
