Overall a poorly managed Hotel that should have better customer service, the staff were full of themselves. We will never valet our car again or alternatively will take photos with the valet next to the car before it is taken.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jess311
Reviews.Content: We stayed there to celebrate my birthday and with the romance package we were suppose to get chocolates, sparkling wine and a gift on arrival however it was not in my room. I waited 45mins before calling the reception to figure out what is the deal with the package. She had no idea and asked me "it isn't in your room?" well obviously not or else i wouldn't have enquired about it would i? 15mins later it was delivered to my room. No phone call was returned to check if i would be in the room and someone was coming with it. - as per the package we booked it said "on arrival" . I didn't recieve it until past 6pm where rooms should be ready for check in at 3pm. Not impressed at all. I asked the girl to inform management about how upset i was as it was suppose to be a celebration and i should be compensated but nothing happened. No compensation whatsoever. Toilets - like everyone else mentioned - airplane toilets, annoyingly loud. Floor boards - got woken up at 7am with what i sounded like possums running on top of your ceiling! - for the people who dont know what it sounds like, it's just loud footsteps never ending. At one stage i thought there was a function area above my room and they were setting it up. Remote control in room didnt work properly - had to take batteries in/out. There was a black sticky tape thing to "glue" the remote together. Positives - Got upgraded Great Views/Location In general staff was nice

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THE PLUMING "ROAR" EACH MORNING”
Reviews.Author: freequent-traveller
Reviews.Content: we have a 3 year old child so booked a Walsh Bay suite so that he coule go to bed at the usual time and we could sit up later. the room has been incredibly well done except for the sofa bed in the living space which regardless of the amounts of cushions on it is hugely uncomfortable. we stayed for 3 nights and each morning were woken at 6am by the roar of plumbing running through the building as other rooms used the bathrooms. the sound was so lound that our 3 year old refused to go to the bathroom because of the monsters in the floor. this was raised with the hotel and the excuse we got was that its a heritage listed building so the plumbing options were limited. regardless, when paying such an amount for a suite like this the last thing you would excpect would be to be woken each morning by such a noise. we have stayed previously in a standard room and never had a problem, so maybe its only a problem in the more expensive suites...go figure that one out!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: papalotta
Reviews.Content: After staying in over 15 different hotels in Sydney over the years I have to say the Sebel is one of the best. Positives: - Gorgeously redecorated rooms. - Great location, just minutes from the rocks with lovely views. - Fantastic friendly service. - The best room service food I've tasted. - Lots of nice additional features and touches. - Fab lobby and outside area for drinks. - Immaculately clean. - Great comfy beds. Negatives: - $7 dollar water - 1.5% credit card surcharge (why? for what?) - Crazy airplane toilets that sound like they're going to suck you in! - No swimming pool. I've stayed her for business, pleasure and for a wedding. Since the redecoration it's even better, a lovely spot that's chilled and relaxed but close to everything. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255100
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a friend for a girls weekend away... The location was wonderful and we were mesmerized with the Sydney Harbour Bridge, what an amazing icon! Our room was nice, comfortable beds and very clean. The bathroom was spacious, however the toilet was extremely noisy especially if it had to be flushed throughout the night whilst the other was sleeping. We ordered breakfast to the room on 2 mornings, it was lovely and still warm when it arrived. We tried to watch a movie however once we had proceeded to confirm the payment, there was no sound. A call to reception was made and we were told someone would come to our room to look into it. 30 minutes later when no one had come, we phoned to advise not to worry but would appreciate it if they would remove the charge from our room, which they did. There was no apology for no one coming to assist. We ran out of toilet paper & tissues and neither were replaced when our room was serviced, so we phoned reception and eventually 1 roll of toilet paper was delivered. We did enjoy our stay and would definitely stay here again, however I feel the service needs to be fine tuned a little.

Reviews.Title: “Shame they don't include breakfast”
Reviews.Author: leona63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and the staff could not be more helpful, friendly. We were upgraded with a lovely view of the harbour. The only downside is that breakfast is not included in the price. As it is one of the most expensive hotels in Sydney, a small continental breakfast would be most welcome and inexpensive for them to provide.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing. Great location, but poor service, terrible food and not good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: CWRG
Reviews.Content: Checking in took 40 minutes because the one receptionist on duty was busy answering telephone calls, talking to friends and could not be bothered. The rooms are clean and functional with environmental toilets that make the sound of a Boeing 737 taking off when you flush them! Unfortunately you can also hear most of the other toilets throughout flushing through the night. The most annoying part is the hotel loves to charge ridiculous prices for every little thing, including 7 dollars for water. They also charge 1.5 per cent for you to use your credit card to check out. Do they reasonably expect people to pay cash?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location spoiled by inconsistent service and lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Geddes_7
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location is just wonderful, right on the wharf with wonderful waterviews of Sydney harbour. On paper this should be a wonderful hotel. However, there is a big "But" coming. I stayed at the hotel for a meeting. The room had been pre-booked (and paid for) as a waterfront room. The room allocated was a rather dark room on the first floor with views of the trees and the sandstone wall on the otherside of the road. When the error was pointed out - it was "oops" - but we are fully booked. Needless to say I didn't see the room that was booked and am yet to see the refund for the difference between the price of the two rooms. (Knowing the operator I have no doubt that it will come) . The room was a little noisy - the toilet system is like those you find on 'planes - a vacuum system and neighbouring activity risks disturbing you with a rapid "whoosh". Closing the door helped, but remembering that the door was shut in the middle of the night created other issues. When shown to the meeting room - it was set up for a wedding not a meeting - oops again. Big scramble in the short time before the meeting. That evening a small group elected to sit on the deck of the hotel and have dinner - the service was patchy, when the white wine arrived it was quite warm, requiring 15 minutes in an ice bucket to get it to drinkable temperature. The food was slow to arrive - it was acceptable, but certainly not to the standard to match the atmoshere. Oops. The same patchiness was repeated at breakfast - no glassware or plates - oops again. The response to requests for these items was unacceptably slow and when delivered they were so hot that it was uncomfortable to handle. Fine for plates, not so for the glass. Oops. There were gaps on the breakfast buffet - oops - scambled eggs when re-filled should have been piping hot, oops they were cold. At least I had a very warm plate. There were several other minor points of irritation - by themselves insufficient to downgrade the rating, but when taken with the other issues illustrative of a hotel that has lost some focus on attention to detail and basic execution skills. Was I impressed with the hotel - yes with the location, no with the service and no with the food. Might it have been an off night maybe, but on the strength of experience - would I return ? No I would not be in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Traveller002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after Xmas 2010 for about 3 days. Have visited Sydney many times and little bit over the tourist area of the Rocks, but this Hotel was a great place to base yourself for Sydney, extremely close to Rocks and tourist things but good place to chill out. Drinks on the wharf were great. Recommend walking over the bridge to cafes and Ripples Cafe down on the waters edge. Bar service a little slack but overall good value

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, once again!”
Reviews.Author: Adelaidejandj
Reviews.Content: Just returned home to Adelaide after spending 7 nights at the Sebel Pier One and need to let people know how much we enjoyed it again. We stayed at the Sebel in January 2010 for 4 nights and said we would definitely be back for more and for longer. So, here we are in January 2011 and we are back! After contacting the hotel staff and letting them know we were returning we were given a great package deal which included breakfast and a Heritage King Room overlooking the harbour. The service and follow-up we received over the phone and by email from Ben and his staff was outstanding and could not be faulted. Well done and thankyou. The big attraction for us with this hotel is its location and the value for money it presents. As tourists the location provides easy access to Circular Quay and its transport hub as well as areas like The Rocks, Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour. The ease of walking to and from the ferries and various eating places and night life is worth a lot in itself and is a factor often overlooked. We find it really easy to fly into Sydney and catch the AirportLink train from the Domestic Terminal to Circular Quay and then walk to the Sebel from there. It takes just 18 minutes on the train from station to station and is stress free. From Circular Quay station you step straight into the atmosphere of the quay and catch your first sight of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House right there in front of you. From there its an easy and exciting short walk (with your bags rolling along behind you) around the quay, under the bridge and in the front door of the hotel. We find it a great way to start our holiday and get right into the 'feel' of Sydney. The room we had was a good size, clean, comfortable and recently refurbished. What more do you need when the delights of Sydney are waiting for you outside? Some people seem to have a problem with the noise the Mirvac tolet system makes when you push the button. Let's take this opportunity to put it in perspective - the noise, yes it is different, but it literally goes for 2 seconds (I timed it!) and then it is completely gone. No hissing of the toilet cistern while it refills, no gurgling water and no 'stuff' flowing through pipes past your room - and it saves water! Enough said! We love the breakfast deal and would recommend it to others for the value and the scenery you can enjoy while eating. How many other hotels allow you to sit on the old wharf front and watch the activities on the harbour unfold while enjoying good food and good service. We always found the staff to be friendly and efficient and always took the time to talk to them. The other great thing we enjoy about this hotel is its 'relaxed formality'. The staff are courteous, efficient and helpful but never in your face. It doesn't have the stuffy feel of some other hotels. If you are into history check out the story of Walsh Bay and spend some time walking in the areas around the hotel and the Rocks. It's well worth it. The beauty of this location is that you are right in the heart of Sydney but away from the hustle and bustle of crowds and traffic. All of that is literally just on the other side of the bridge. Have a look at a map and you will see what we mean. After spending the day out and about it was always relaxing to walk back to the hotel along the waterfont and finish the day with a cocktail or two in the bar. You can feel the serenity! As you have probably guessed by now we love Sydney and we love staying at the Sebel Pier One when we are there. Our thanks to the management and staff for another great holiday. Yes, we will be going back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with lack of quality”
Reviews.Author: SometimesSkiing
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at the Sebel, Pier One in Sydney for ten nights over Christmas and New Year 2010, and unfortunately we were far from impressed with the overall experience. Upon checking into our room we immediately noticed a bad smell in the room, which we were told was due to the fact that the room had been â€œrecently renovatedâ€�, however the smell seemed to be more like that from wet carpet. As we were unpacking, I hung my robe upon a wooden peg in the panelling behind the bed, and the peg promptly fell out of the wall and onto the floor. The trim at the window end of the wooden panelling behind the bed was not fixed in place, and in fact was simply leaning against the window curtains. Attempting to move this away from the window so that the sliding door could be opened resulted in this also falling onto the floor. The blind could not be lowered as the electronic control was not working, and one of the bedside lights was also not working. The light in the wardrobe was completely missing â€“ just a hole in the ceiling where the fitting should have been. Another light in the room had no bulb and was cracked around the ceiling. I attempted to telephone the concierge to report these faults, but to my surprise the telephone was not working either! Upon inspection I discovered that the telephone was not even connected - the cable that should have been plugged into the telephone socket on the wall was coiled up and taped to the underside of the table upon which it stood. I went down and spoke to the concierge in person and was told that the problems would be fixed as soon as possible. Incidentally, whilst most of the faults were subsequently repaired, the trim at the window end of the panelling was not repaired at all during our stay, to my knowledge. We decided to have dinner in the hotelâ€™s restaurant on our first evening, ordering the pork and the mushroom tart. Once again we were sorely disappointed, the greater part of the pork was simply inedible fat and gristle, and the mushroom tart was so overcooked that the pastry was literally burnt to a crisp. The Duty Manager attempted to correct the electronics that prevented the blinds from closing, TV from working etc, but to no avail and it was decided that Maintenance would be available the following day. This did get corrected. On the following day the hairdryer stopped working after about thirty seconds of use, and on the day after that we noticed that there was water all over the floor in the bathroom. An inspection of the underside of the steel basin revealed that it was not fixed to the bench top at all, and was held in place only by the wastepipe. There was a 2cm gap between the edge of the basin and the bench top, and water was able to pour through this gap when the basin was filled. A maintenance operator came and glued the basin back to the bench top, whereupon water began to leak from the wastepipe at the join. By this time we felt that the room was no longer habitable and requested that we be relocated to another room with a similar harbour view â€“ a view which we had booked and paid for in advance. Before we were relocated we noticed several other faults with the room â€“ the ceiling was cracked around one of the down lights, some cracked tiles in the bathroom, and there was considerable evidence of mould and rot around the bathroom door. The duty manager found us another similar room on the same floor, but it only had half the view â€“ our initial room had a window which spanned the whole width of the room, whereas the new roomâ€™s window was only half the width of the room, a serious impediment to the view we had requested and paid for. The duty manager explained that this was the best he could do under the circumstances as the hotel was near to full occupancy as it was Christmas. I told him that although we accepted his explanation we were far from happy, and that we had documented our grievances, along with photographic evidence where appropriate, and that we would be making Mirvac Hotels aware of these shortcomings. The bad smell we had encountered in our initial room was also evident in the new room. We remained in this room until the end of our stay, and although the accommodation was adequate, it was not quite what we had paid for. Furthermore, the television remote control failed on the second day in the replacement room, and although it was only caused by flat batteries, this added to the general dissatisfaction we were feeling. The television sound quality was awful, particularly on the pay-per-view movies â€“ we paid for three movies during the course of our stay, but had to abandon them on each occasion because of the atrocious sound quality, the dialog being either badly distorted or periodically too low to hear at all. This was evident in both rooms, and would suggest to me that there is something fundamentally wrong with the rediffusion equipment. There were a number of other minor inconveniences too, sometimes the housekeepers forgot to leave wash cloths, or enough towels, or a bath mat, or shampoo... none of these very important when considered separately but when added to the other seemingly never-ending list of complaints you can possibly understand why we were dissatisfied. The iron had a build-up of burned material stuck on it which managed to ruin 2 items of clothing despite attempts to clean it. The hotelâ€™s general manager did invite us to have dinner in the restaurant again, at the hotelâ€™s expense, as a measure of apology for the level of inconvenience that we had endured. The meal was enjoyable and we thank the general manager and the respective duty managers for their concern and continued courtesy and apologies. We ordered room service on a few occasions, and the meals and service were of an excellent standard, as were the outstanding buffets on Christmas Day and New Years Eve. We were asked in an email whether we enjoyed our stay at the Sebel â€“ in all honesty we could not give an affirmative reply, neither could we in all conscience consider recommending the hotel to any of our friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location but smart design has led to poor function.”
Reviews.Author: PennyH051
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for interrupted nights if you, your partner or one of your neighbours uses the toilet. As an earlier reviewer said, it's an airline loo. It operates on a vacuum and would wake the dead. Additionally, the smart doors to the bathroom operate with a metal clasp system which simply cannot be opened or closed quietly. The designer seems to have been smart rather than clever. Two more examples: 1. the attractive table style bathroom vanity stands about 5 cm away from the wall mirror behind it - if something drops down that space it's a hands and knees job to get it back; 2. the cabinet holding bar fridge and drawers was very deep - so deep that there was only about a 20 cm gap between cabinet and bed, which we had to walk through to get to our outside table. But ah! the location is just marvellous and the proximity to the water is probably unbeaten by any other hotel in the CBD. Snacking or drinking on the terrace is a great experience, with the boating activity going right past. We stayed at Pier One because it was close to a theatre the Sydney Theatre Company uses and walking around those reconstructed Piers is something not to be missed as well. Another reviewer noted that it was hard to get a decent breakfast elsewhere in the vicinity. We ignored that advice to our cost and searched for nearly 45 minutes through the Rocks on 29 December. Sebel Pier One has an a la carte breakfast menu and we should have chosen that.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aargyle1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business early on in December and we were not disappointed the slightest!.. the location is stunning pictures do not do it justice what so ever, the bar and restaurant in situated right on the waters edge and made for the perfect place for an afternoon beer (disappointed they did not have fosters) with the sun setting against the harbour! The rooms had all been recently refurbished, so new that they still have that new smell to them! its all done in a white heritage style which was a huge change to the "typical hotels" that we are used to staying. Like the last person i also had trouble finding the ipod docking station but it is hidden in the bedside radio system and it pops out! Kate on the front desk was a delight to talk with and the concierge Joshua was very informative of the city he made some fantastic restaurant recommendations and sent us across to Manly on the ferry for a wonderful afternoon by the beach! Overall it was a pretty perfect stay, apart form having to work soo much hopefully i can come back next time for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Benoni100
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location, over the water in Walsh Bay, just a short stroll from the Rocks, Opera House and almost directly under the Harbour Bridge. Unfortunately, our room was rather small, the hotel corridor smelled damp and despite promises on the website there was no i-Pod dock we could find and the windows did not open. The bathrooms were old-fashioned - and the toilet made a noise like an aircraft toilet. I was also very disappointed with the staff, many of whom appeared to be backpackers, or minimum wagers. Although free access to a business centre was useful, free wifi would have been more so. I was annoyed to have been asked for a credit card by the very surly barman just minutes after handing a card over to reception to act as a guarantee for in-house charges and the duty manager treated my complaint with disdain. Breakfast offered a good selection but the scrambled eggs were cold and service non-existent. Used plates were never removed. With so many good hotels in Sydney it would be hard to recommend this one, which appears to be resting on its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “This is the review of the Sebel Pier One in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: falgunirath
Reviews.Content: Date:17th July 2010 My company booked this hotel for my stay in sydney for a meeting. I have stayed in many hotels but this one was unique as it is the one and only hotel built over water near the sydney bridge.The hotel was luxurious and the service was excellent. Another important thing is that you will get great Australian food. I recommend this hotel to everyone who goes to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Completely adorable!”
Reviews.Author: judid
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is fantastic! Rooms are lovely and clean, at worst, maybe a little small. But the views are fantastic. The bar downstairs just allows you to sit back and take in the ambiance & glittering harbour that is Sydney. Wonderful cocktails too - served by very friendly staff. A place of indulgence, but life is too short for bad hotels! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous as usual”
Reviews.Author: billybobVictoria
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sebel again, and cant recommend it enough, we were told we had a heritage room upstairs but we always prefer one on the ground floor, no problem we were moved immediately, ate in the restaurant and the service was fantastic, the waitress remembered us from last time , and told us whatt to eat and drink and she was right. will look forward to our next stay. jeanna

Reviews.Title: “Under the bridge.....but uniquely top!”
Reviews.Author: dodgydavis
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to discover in Sydney.....ok the views from some rooms are not great, BUT you are right on the water......right under the bridge and just around the corner from the opera house and 'downtown' Sydney. Some great restaurants within walking distance. Get a water taxi from just outside the door, or walk ten minutes around to central quay to get a ferry to everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “bring plenty of money if you want to eat and drink”
Reviews.Author: thorcycle
Reviews.Content: Ever go to a seaside restaurant that had terrible food but high prices simply because of the location? That is the story here. Especially the bar and restaurant. How much should eggs, juice and bacon cost for breakfast? Try $30. ($30!!). Want some scotch? $22 for one ounce. Have a double and you will have paid what the hotel paid for the whole bottle (That's a 12 to 1 markup). Funny thing is that the prices are the same at the Park Hyatt -- but there you can count on the highest quality in food and the service. Everyone is kind here but they just are not professional. These are Shangri-La prices in a Holiday Inn. The view of the harbour simply does not justify the price. Use your money more wisely than on this hotel. Oh -- and no need to set the alarm for the morning. You can hear every toilet in the building flush.

Reviews.Title: “Currently under refurbisment!”
Reviews.Author: Queenpugh
Reviews.Content: Pro's Fantastic location, moments from The Rocks, views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera house on your doorstep. Great coffee shops and restaurants on Hickson road and around the waterfront. Room was really clean and tidy. Lovely outside tables to enjoy a drink and watch the sunset. Room service was quick, delicious and well priced. Con's Half the hotel bedrooms on our floor are undergoing some VERY noisy refurbishment! We were given a complimentary upgrade to a King room (220) but was opposite the lifts and right next to the construction which started at 7am!!! Moved rooms straight away were it was quieter (235). Really noisy airline vacuum toilets No Wifi and charges were $20 per day! Steep. Breakfast not included. No car park, $35 a day. 1.5% charge to pay with credit card! Hard, lumpy beds. Would stay here again but after refurb is complete and would hunt out a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting off the beaten path location.”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my last night in Australia after a five month visit. I thought I was splurging for something special. The Sebel Pier One was fine, bit nothing extraordinary. I have a water view room, but that is somewhat misleading. Because of the angle of the hotel and the land, you don't seem much interesting out the window. The bed was very comfortable and I got a good night's rest. The hotel is very convenient to Circle Quay and Harbour Bridge, but is tucked away in a somewhat quiet area. I'd stay here again, if I got a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position for Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: SDiplock
Reviews.Content: Although our room was pretty ordinary the hotel was great with fantastic views and close to The Rocks and the Circular Quay attractions. We ate outside on the waters edge, lunch and dinner, both good value. Very friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: MetalPigeon
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel because the location is great and the staff are very good. Being in the Rocks is the best place to stay in Sydney and breakfast on the terrace outside on a bright, cool Aussie winter morning is hard to beat. The room was fine (Waterfront Queen) and it was lovely to have a view of the water just there. On the negative side the rooms are in need of a refurbishment and they do feel a bit dated. The breakfast was fine but it is a bit of scrum in the morning and they could do with more space. Only two real irritations - the price they charge for broadband and the fact that you have to pay extra for a latte or variation on the standard coffee. Why do some hotels do this?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: watermelon_23
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via a Mystery deal through wotif.com and paid about $180. I particularly wanted a hotel near The Rocks and was initially a bit disappointed that I wasn't staying in a hotel that overlooked Circular Quay. But my stay at the Sebel Pier One really changed my mind. The room was very nice. Clean, and the beds were fantastic. We were out and about all of the first day so we decided to stay in and have room service for dinner. The food was delicious and not overly priced (in my opinion). The next day we had a great time exploring the side of The Rocks that we would not normally go to. We left our luggage with the concierge and they were very helpful getting us a taxi when it was time to leave. My one complaint was the lack of service at the bar on the day we checked out. We had come back to the hotel to have a coffee on the deck overlooking the water before we left for the day, and the service was incredibly slow (took 20 minutes to get a coffee and a hot chocolate). Other than that we had a great time and I would definitely recommend this hotel. Particularly if you get a mystery deal as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay :)”
Reviews.Author: chattabox44
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Pier One and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The room was beautiful, light and bright and as it was a Waterside Queen room it had great views over the Harbour looking toward McMahon's Point. All staff members I encountered were wonderful and as friendly as could be. I work in hotels myself so I know a good hospitality worker when I see one. Breakfast was delicious and although it was a chilly morning, we were able to sit outside in the covered, heated area. All in all it was a wonderful night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: All staff encountered were helpful and did their jobs well. The rooms are comfortable, as are the bathrooms and amenities. The restaurant/bar area is bright, light and inviting with lovely views. The rooms without the harbour view have small windows but if you choose to look you can still see the water. The accommodation is well priced for the calibre and location. The toilets are akin to those in an aeroplane and can at times be disconcerting, when they gurgle happily away for no apparent reason. A minor detraction however.

Reviews.Title: “what very lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pkoz43
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010 the staff were very good and very helpful and only 1o Min's Walk to circular Que i fond that it is very resemble in prise for the rating of the hotel and would stay here the next i come too Sydney the room was very nice and on the TV when got to room in had a welcome in my name witch i thought was was very good

Reviews.Title: “a run down overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitty555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were hoping to celebrate our wedding anniversary overlooking the harbour sipping champagne. We were very disappointed with our ground floor room which was right next to the carpark. The room opened directly onto the footpath and every passer by peered into the room. Our only chance to have any privacy was to close the curtains- not quite the water view we hoped for! The furniture was very shabby (laminate was peeling off many pieces). The toilet made the noise of an aircraft toilet ( and we could hear all the surrounding toilets flush during the night). The wharf next door was hosting a party with thumping music which reverberated across the water for hours. We could not wait to leave and would not recommend that anyone stay here. We stayed in another Sydney hotel two months later for the same price. The experience was totally different and we finally celebrated our anniversary in the way we originally intended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AusTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel sells itself. I quite liked the style of the room but can understand that it may not be to every ones taste. Bed could have been better but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel?”
Reviews.Author: greented05
Reviews.Content: Great location just under the Harbour Bridge, but the hotel is dated, a bit dirty and a disappointment! After a long day of meetings I decided to not brave the cold outside and order room service. The food was horrible and over priced! The food standard was equal to a bad shopping center food court! If I was here for a personal holiday I would be really annoyed, but I'm here for work for one night....so I will get over it!

Reviews.Title: “My Experience..”
Reviews.Author: extralite
Reviews.Content: Good location about 10 mins walk from Cicrcular Quay underneath the Harbour Bridge. If walking from the Quay be aware that there is not much signage on the front so I missed ot the first time. Reading other reviews there may be big differences int he grades of rooms. I stayed in theu basic room at $229 a night so still not budget, and only $50 less than the Shangri-LA (which was booked out this night). For that its a small room, no view except of bridge. I would be okay with this as it is functional. But if i were manager, i would be trying to make it better value by not creating a perception of being overcharged for basics like a bottle of Mt Franklin water in the room for $7.00 when everyone knows it wholesales for around $1.00, charging $20 for internet. It creates a perception of everything in the hotel being over-priced. Breakfast was good, good location, friendly staff. So overall okay but with a few small changes they could create a culture of it being very good value rather than a bit overpriced. (Available for brand management jobs anytime :) ) Thanks to the staff, they were professional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well situated, value for money, convenient - a pleassure.”
Reviews.Author: narulavishalhotmail
Reviews.Content: This was a Business trip for 3 weeks. At the first sight I was not very impressed by the Hotel. The booking was easy as I could book by calling the Hotel and confirming the booking on email. The check in was quick and Hotel staff was very courteous and hospitable. When i entered my room it was more luxurious than I expected. The bed was very comfortable and it was easy to sink in and fall asleep immediately. The Hotel is right under teh SYdney Harbour Bridge and along the Sydney Harbour. It overlooks the harbour and a few rooms also give the view of the Sydney Opera Theatre. Its a beautiful sight to have right outside your room. Especially on weekends, the harbour is full of boats and sails which are a delight to watch. Sydney Opera is a 7 min walk from the Hotel and the walk on the promenade along the harbour itself is beautiful. Many tourist attractions such as The Rocks, The Royal Botanic Gardens, George Street, Pitt Street, Elizabeth Street, etc. At the Sydney opera is the Circular Quai Station and Harbour which makes all your travel easy since you have many options of Boats and trains to all parts of NSW and out of NSW. The Hotel has buffet breakfast which is a wide spread of Continental and English dishes. One can have a heavy breakfast at the hotel and venture out the whole day. The Hotel has Laundry Service which is very efficient, Room Service which is also very efficient. The Room service and restaurant menu have limited choices. But whatever is on the menu is great and the chefs do not mind tweaking their recepies to suit your mood. There are 2 Bar in the Hotel. It attracts good crowd so the evenings can get pretty lively. The Bahroom is spacious and the Hotel staff keeps it clean and tidy. The rooms have minibar which have really good beer and wine in the room along with a very tasty selection of snacks. Overall, its a pleasure to stay at this Hotel. It will be a really romantic place to stay. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: itstimeforabreak
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. The rooms are really nice and comfortable, whilst not overly modern, they are neat, clean and exactly what we needed for our weekend away. The toilets are not as bad as i expected, yes they are loud, but next door never woke me with theirs!!! The breakfast was yummy, great variety. The bar was nice, however I was little dissapointed that they had run out of a few ingredients on a Sunday everning (which i found strange as they have a restaurant on site????) so I could not have a couple of the cocktails that were on their list. The concierge team were ok, they always seeemd to be too busy, and we had to wait for them, and they were then very short with their answers etc. (except when it came to explaining about tours,were clearly there was an incentive for them to spend some time with us) All in all a nice well located hotel. Only a short walk to majority of the touristy things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SBS_Ferrets
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 lovely nights getting over our jet lag at the Sebel. The staff were very helpful and polite. Nice room with a view of the bridge, lovely historic feel to the building. We loved the walk along the waterfront to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “I wont be going back”
Reviews.Author: TillyandOscar
Reviews.Content: The Sebel Pier 1 has been my number one selection for the last couple of year, both for when I have had business trips and on the occasion where a sydney stopover was part of a holiday. The first few times were good, the rooms are spacious and the location is great - I guess I didn't really need much as I was only ever there for a night and not much of it. A couple of visits back I revieved the Sebel's feedback email and I notified them that I had found quite alot of hair in the bathroom when I arrived, other than that everything was fine. The next time I visited, the room again had hairs in the bathroom (don't they vacume??) and found that when I went to jump into the big comfy bed, they had stopped putting two sheets on the beds and reverted to just having one sheet and the doona. When I phoned reception to check - the person told me they had stopped putting two on because it meant they had to launder two sheets and a doona cover, now they could save on 1 sheet! I made sure I filled out the feedback card in the room so they knew how I felt. The last time I checked in - again hairs in the bathroom. Normally when we stay we have to leave very early in the morning, but this time when the man at front desk asked me if we were leaving early, we happily replied that for once we didn't, it was our anniversary and we were going to enjoy our first sleep-in in years! Little did we know! We went out for dinner and returned late, hopping into bed (our single sheeted one) at about 1am, knowing that we could sleep until it was time to go. We were woken up at 7.30 am by drilling either above us or next door to us! At first we tried to ignore it, thinking this really couldn't be happening. and by 8.30 my husband got up andphoned reception to check when they thought the drilling would stop. He was told they would find out. 1/2 hour later we phoned again because we hadn't heard anything. Apparently it was outside contractors working on the roof and they couldn't control it. Now really, if the hotel has contractors working on the roof they would know about it and a professional hotel would communicate that to its reservations manager so they could ensure they don't put anyone underneath it. Even more so, I would expect it would be clearly communicated to front office staff so they would be aware of the disturbence. If it had have been communicated - then when we told the man checking us in that we were sleeping in - he could have moved us. Sorry Sebel, this may seem harsh - but I ignored the hairs i the bathrooms on numerous occasions, even dealt with having only 1 sheet, but when you mess with someones sleep, especially when they don't usually get much - its going too far. I did tell the girl at reception that we were not happy and her response was I should fill out a feedback card - but clearly the other times when i have filled out their cards nothing has happened so why should I bother again. I asked her to pass it onto her GM, however I doubt it was passed on. Why is it that big hotels think that feedback forms are the be all and end all - they don't seem to be utilised to help guests and what happend to good old verbal feedback being communicated. I will be staying elsewhere from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: BjoernAhrens
Reviews.Content: Unparalleled location right next to Harbour Bridge and Opera, stunning foyer, great breakfast, decent rooms. So much for the Brownie points. But then there's the wild mood swings of the showers (switching from "Freeze!" to "Burn!" in a split second), the average desk service and that overall feeling that the Pier One seems to rest on his laurels. Recommended with some reservations (no pun intended!).

Reviews.Title: “love the fish tank floor”
Reviews.Author: GetawayOz
Reviews.Content: Yes liked it and was quite surprised at the design and fitout. Excellent car parking and service. Where else can you have your car looked after so close to the city. Drinks and breakfast a little expensive but great view great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days at hotel -- location and price cannot be beat for hotel in Rocks area and close to everything. Hotel is very nice (old wharehouse on pier/converted) so has that old charm one expects for being in the Rocks area. We got a great deal on the price of the room ($100 US cheaper than others in the area) and the breakfast buffet (approx $22 US) has a fantastic selection. The staff goes out of their way to take care of you -- if you are expecting the Marriott or Shangri La experience then do not stay here -- you will be disaapointed as it is an older hotel. However, the rooms are very nice and have everythign you desire. One downside is the gym is very old and has really old stuff -- however if you walk the city you will get many opportunities to work out. We would most definitely stay here again -- the location, price and staff amke this an awesome selection. Comment: Recommend you buy the week pass for travel on boat, train and bus....better than the daily rate. Also took the train to Blue Mountain and saved over $100/pp by doing so rather than paying for a tour. The Hunter valley wine tour was good -- if you want to see Boutique Wineries. Also recommend the Paragon, Three Wise Monkies and Lord Nelson as great places to lift a Pint and take in some local flavor. All in all a super trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Awful - Dirty and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: LuciaChester
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I had booked our dream holiday to Australia stopping in Singapore on the way. We stayed at the Fairmont in Singapore which is 4 star. It was fantastic and set my expectations. I had read the reviews of Pier One and Trail Finders in the UK booked this for me. We arrived at the hotel after a 9 hour flight from Singapore. The room we were given was dank, dirty.......my tummy is turing thinking about it. Firstly there was a burnt orange armchair with a calico cover (Ikea like) which had large stains on it. It was disgusting. The dark blue carpet was stained and dank looking. My first thought was how will I put my bare feet down on this. The furniture was old and damaged. The glass tops were filthy. The towels in the bathroom were frayed and torn. The air vent in the bathroom also had inches of old dust and hairs hanging from it. I immediately asked to change rooms. The duty manager showed me another room that was frankly worse. I called trailfinders in the UK to see if they could help me out. In the end I had to stay in the first room. Now for the next shock.............the bedding was damp. The following morning I spoke to Ben the duty manager. I brought a torn towel with me as evidence. Ben was to say the least a bit ignorant. He told that they had identified that the hotel needed a refurbishment. While I agreed that was out of his control I stated that the cleaning was easily within his remit. The hotel is apparently a Hertiage building built in 1865. Fantastic I told him, come to Europe and we can show you to do old and clean. The common areas are tatty and unclean too. I was moved to another room which Ben oversaw the cleaning of. It was cleaner alright but the rust on the venetian blinds, toilet roll holder and shower pole made it difficult to enjoy a shower (and yes it was a curtain). This was the most expensive hotel i stayed in on my holiday. Please do not stay here until they have done the refurbishment they have identified! Identified it was blantantly obvious. This ruined my stay in Sydney and both my patner & I felt dirty whilst there. We need the Bonza Bike tour (absolutely fantastic) and they told us that the hotel had been flooded a couple of weeks before we arrived. Now I understood by the bedding felt dank. It was a very bad expensive experience. This is not 4 and half stars. It was like a very old dirty outdated Travel Lodge (forgive Travel lodge). I will refrain from starting on the breakfast. I paid in total Â£13,000 sterling for my holiday so you can see I was not scrimping. So Sebel Pier One. I hope you are ashamed of yourselves. Maybe the Sebel chain should employ managers who are up the job and ensure that standards are kept to worldwide standards. This place is only for Australian business people that have been set a nightly limit by their companies. It is not for a seasoned traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Top location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoodyBris
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in February and can highly recommend. The hotel is just on the far side of the Rocks and right beside the Harbour Bridge. Half the rooms face out and look onto the harbour. Location is great as it is just a 5 minute walk to the rocks and a very short 2 minute stroll to look over to the Opera House. If you have any worries about the location, then don't as it is vet close to the Rocks. Room was very clean, tidy, plush and with all the amenities. Air con was quiet. Staff were very friendly and polite. Restaurant and bar were reasonably priced and you could get bar meals as well as eat in the restaurant. Breakfasts were brilliant and probably the best I have seen in any hotel anywhere in the world. The selection was massive and even had things like fresh passion fruit and Yakult drinks. Restaurant and bar over looked the harbour and you could sit right on the pier front, which was very relaxing way to watch the sun go down. In another review someone mentioned that the toilets were noisy!! They completely forgot to mention that the toilets environmentally friendly are a designed to use something like half the water of a normal toilet. The noise lasts for about 2 seconds and then are totally silent, unlike a normal toilet that makes a noise for a few minutes as it is refilling. This hotel is very quiet and you can hear absolutely no noise from the bridge even when sitting outside on the pier. Really could not recommend enough. I would go back like a flash. One thing we did find is that it was cheaper to book directly through the hotel than though agents. Pricing wise compared to other hotels I would say it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valentine's Day Package”
Reviews.Author: johndborg
Reviews.Content: We booked the Valentine's day package and found it fantastic value for money. The included five course dinner in the Front Restaurant was a great experience. The dinner included matching Australian wines (commended on not using Kiwi ones). Our table had good views over the harbour. Both restaurant and hotel staff were very friendly and competent. Loved the heritage listed building and the fantastic location. Our room service breakfast was also good and finished off a great night out.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: Adelaidejandj
Reviews.Content: Just returned home (Adelaide) after spending 4 nights at the Sebel Pier One and have already been telling our friends about how good this place is. We booked through lastminute.com and got a fantastic room rate for a hotel in this location. Having stayed in Sydney on a few previous occasions (but in different hotels/apartments) I was well aware of how handy the location of this hotel would be to access areas like Circular Quay, The Rocks, CBD and Darling Harbour to name a few. Literally 50metres from the front door of the hotel and you are standing at the waters edge looking at the magnificent Sydney Harbour and Opera House, not to mention looking up and seeing one of the great icons of Australia, the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Being within casual strolling distance of the ferries,trains and buses at Circular Quay is a huge bonus if you don't want to be driving a car around Sydney. All are within 5 minutes walking time (10 minutes if you chill out and enjoy the sights and sounds at a slower pace) from the hotel. This short walk is a great way to start and finish your day of sightseeing, no matter what time of the day or night it might be. You have probably guessed by now we were impressed by the location! The hotel and its facilities provide excellent value for money and is one we found more enjoyable to stay in than some of the much more expensive and 'stuffy' 5 star hotels around. Whilst the rooms are not large they are very well appointed, comfortable, and above all, clean. We spent most of our days enjoying the sights of Sydney and only needed the room to sleep and recharge before heading out to do it all again. Why stay in your room when you can sit out on the pier and relax and take in the views? We found all staff members to be friendly, courteous and helpful (with no exceptions). If you offer a smile and a friendly greeting it's amazing what responses you get when dealing with people! Some travellers should try it - it's not that hard to do. The breakfast deal at the hotel is an absolute bargain! We had the full breakfast each day and that provided our fuel to get us through most of the day. If you don't want to eat at the hotel there are plenty of eating places in the Quay and Rocks areas or at a couple of the local pubs within a short stroll. Watch out for the rabbits under the bridge on your way to the Harbour View Hotel, and the bats flying overhead at dusk (yes really!). All in all, GREAT holiday, GREAT location. We'll be back, no doubt about that!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: KarC10
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at Sebel Pier One and what a pleasure it was to stay there. We were in one of their more basic rooms as part of a package, but it was spacious, clean with all the 4-41/2 star trappings. The view from our room was about as close as you can get to the harbour bridge and also a glimpse of Walsh Bay. The room was very quiet and the bed comfortable, which is a bonus for someone like me who is a light sleeper. A bath/shower are part of a spacious bathroom. The hotel, which is part of a restored building, is built on one of the old piers, so you are over the water. You can see the water through the glass floor section in the lounge area downstairs. When we arrived we sat out in the outside cafe area with a coffee and watched the water traffic go by. We also had one meal in their restaurant which we thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel is in a great location behind The Rocks and within walking distance of Circular Quay and The Rocks restaurants and market, if you're there on the weekend. We will return here on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, superb location”
Reviews.Author: 5usam3
Reviews.Content: Concierge service exceptional - - great recommendations - - especialy nearby restaurants. Breakfast buffet great. Queen water view room - - comfortable bed, wonderful view, big, practical bath, excellent maid service. Suggest ramp at front entrance for easier bag transfer by concierge (also baggage handler).

Reviews.Title: “Just Nice”
Reviews.Author: sezza01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at his hotel for 2 nights with my partner, the staff were always friendly and helpful, nothing was too much hassle, and the room was very spacious and modern, with a unique twist. The location was fantastic, directly next door to the harbour bridge. And im so glad they provided valet parking (addition cost) because itâ€™s such a hassle to find a park in Sydney. Overall I was happy with my stayâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellinRooster
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel if you are traveling and want to be right in the heart of Sydney. Location is everything with this hotel. Do not stay here if you are looking for a luxurious Sydney getaway as this Mirvac Hotel is just a step up from a basic business hotel. The staff are very friendly and courteous, if slightly less than that "hotel professional" that we do so love when staying in a 5 star. The rooms are large enough, but are just starting to tire a little and have that feeling of having seen quite a lot of traffic. We only ate breakfast at the buffet so I have limited view of the overall quality of the kitchen. The breakfast was ample and reasonable quality, although we did have to wait for about 20 min before they could fit us in - so we perched at the bar for a coffee. Not a drama for us, though others seemed quite irate at having to wait. All-in-all a satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “location , location , location , walking distance from everything.”
Reviews.Author: vanegric1
Reviews.Content: stayed once before on business. went this time for 25th wedding anniversary. right from the check-in the service was again as good as the first time, from the complimentary bottle of wine for our anniversary, to the smiling freindly attitude from the staff , i knew this was going to be a good stay, and it was.a little expensive for my tastes but im from a smaller country town in central qld.but not as expensive as some of the hotels in the area,which i priced.so all in all value for money in that area.and what an area....nestled just beside the harbour bridge, but quiet,a stones throw from the opera house,even closer to the "rocks",restaurants ,ferries,train station,shops,bus stops,wow...what a place..be careful some areas more expensive than others... back to the hotel...the staff are what makes a hotel..the rooms are comfortable ,not overdone,normal elements included bar ,tv,movies,etc,but lets face it,you sleep in it.... you dont live in it..beds are really comfy..buffet breakfast..a little expensive but wow the range and quality of the food is fantastic..and again the staff were great. dinner...well...not as good, but that may be because my tastes arent as refined as some sydney folk. {meat and potato sort of bloke} i am.overall 4 out of 5 rating..would i stay there again...absolutely....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Easy. Great Views, food and ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: WaCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our wedding night in a Walsh Bay suite-right on the water with beautiful views of Cokatoo Island, greeted by Bvalgari gift set, sparkling wine a belgian chocolates and a nice card. We dined in room form the very affordable room service menu and had a wonderful meal. The room was clean and the bathroom was excellent. We had a great breakfast the next day-very fresh and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and views, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: Diana482
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebel Pier One Sydney for the first two nights of a 2 week honeymoon in Australia. Pros: Hotel is in a fantastic location, it is right on the harbor in an area called The Rocks with great views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Circular Quay is just a short walk away. We arrived at about 8am after flying all the way from Washington, DC and they had our room ready and allowed us to check in. (Tip: I had requested early check in ahead of time and this may have helped). Enjoyed drinks at the hotel bar in early evening and breakfast one morning. Buffet breakfast is expensive, but they allowed us to just have cereal and coffee for a discounted price. Good sized room and large bathroom with tub shower. Favorite thing about the hotel was its proximity to the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens. Mu husband and I went running in the Botanical Gardens every morning and then back to the hotel for breakfast. Cons: Bed was hard and not very comfortable. Overall, room felt a little tired and had worn carpet. Toilet flush is quite loud as other reviews suggested, but it didn't bother me. Recommended Activities: Walking (or jogging) in the Botanical Gardens and along the Harbor, Museum of Contemporary Art (free and very close to hotel), Ferry to Manly Beach, Bus to Bondi Beach, Wonderful Sushi at Yoshii Restaurant not far from hotel, Sunday Market in the Rocks, Drinks and dessert a Opera Bar at Sydney Opera House, and seeing the symphony at the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: Ally026
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in a waterside room. the rooms were large and modern with classy bathrooms, and great views across the harbour. It was a 15 minute walk tio Circular Quay, and so handy for the Rocks area. At night it is fairly quiet and dark around the Hotel and some might prefer to get a taxi back from town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: humidsue
Reviews.Content: The Sebel Pier One Hotel is aptly named, since it is built on in old pier, just around the corner from the Sydney Opera House. The price was the best I got for a same -quality hotel. After arriving from my international flight, my room was not quite ready, so I was able to use a room with a bath to freshen up and relax in. Our room was lovely and the view off the back (pier) during breakfast was fabulous. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Failed the basic test of any hotel: the bed was hard as nails”
Reviews.Author: crosNewcastle_N_S_W_
Reviews.Content: Beautifully situated "on" Sydney Harbour, Sebel Pier One is a stylish, pleasant hotel. The conversion to a hotel has been sympathetically achieved. Apart from the odd creak you wouldn't know you were in a very old building jutting out into the Harbour. The rooms are very well appointed, but I had 2 main beefs: I found the bed too hard by far and made sleeping impossible and the fixed shower head over a tall bath made showering difficult and potentially treacherous getting in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location for a sunny weekend”
Reviews.Author: morrie28
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at the Sebel Pier one at the end of winter. We were really lucky to have perfectly sunny warm days, which made the hotel's location even better. The outdoor deck area was the perfect place to spend a sunny afternoon with a cold drink. The rooms are a bit tired and ours was small but it's difficult to complain too much, when the cost was only $159 per night. We did have a view of the harbour bridge, but the windows on the eastern side are small and do not open. It is an easy walk to the Rocks and central Sydney and there are many good restaurants and pubs nearby. Service was OK, only had one hiccup with a room service meal not arriving. When rang room service to query its whereabouts they admitted to not noting my room number so didn't know who ordered. Wouldn't have mattered too much, but had a show to go to. To their credit the staff member admitted it was her fault, the meal arrived promptly and I wasn't charged for it. Had breakfast one morning at the hotel, which was quite good. There are also plenty of eateries west of the hotel along the piers which are reasonably priced and had good food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller70
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip with my Fiancee, as she had not been to Australia before i wanted the hotel to be in a location which is easy to get to the main attractions. Rooms Clean and well maintained , fair size but nothing special Service Below par for a hotel of this standard but nothing that could be ignored Location Great just under that Bridge, the only hotel over water in Sydney, easy to get taxis as well Over all was a good hotel , though it is more about the location than anything else

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Foots14
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving this hotel an "excellent" rating is because the rooms are in a bit of disrepair, however, we were told that they already had a renovation scheduled. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our schedule caused us to be too early for check in, but they immediately gave us a room to shower and freshen up after our very long flight. The location couldn't have been better. It's on the harbor in an are called The Rocks with great views of the Opera House. Good shopping and sightseeing is within walking distance. I wish they had a more comprehensive fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Maddisons
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Rocks and short walk to circular quay. The room was a really good size ( we had a two yr old in the pull down sofa and still loads of room to play) and the view of the bridge was spectacular. Downside, the staff were very unfriendly, hardly seen anyone of them smile the entire time we were there. They were professional but very unwelcoming. Didn't spend much time in the hotel, so staff didn't really matter. Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great food & comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeff57_9
Reviews.Content: Located right on Sydney harbour, far enough away to be quiet and serene yet close enough to the heart of Sydney to walk anywhere without effort. Loved the few days spent there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but watch the credit card fees”
Reviews.Author: rileyinut
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, big well maintainrooms. Simply awesome views with a good location but a bit further out than other hotels yet still walkable. Downsides were a poor fitness room and equipment and most of all charging a very high currency conversation rate on my credit card at checkout.. Nearly 10% higher than the actual exchange rate. When I asked about this they made the correction but keep an eye out for that.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you - Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: stumble
Reviews.Content: My wife booked our 25 wedding anniversary weekend at this hotel. The location is just perfect, close to all Sydney Harbour has to offer, but just tucked away enough to be private. All the staff knew our names and reason for staying and we have never been there before. It was a truely memorable couple of days, and the hotel, location and staff just added to these memories. We had brunch on the wharf, and late drinks very pleasant. we will be back, but will not wait 25 yrs for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - but slightly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MRPHILLLEE
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel: the laid back staff; the views from the Waterside Rooms; the location; and the free bottle of champagne and AUS$50 credit for use at the bar/restaurant! I would recommend this hotel to friends and family - but I did feel that is was a little bit overpriced. We got a stay for four nights and only pay for three deal via Trailfinders so it was not too bad - but I would not have paid full price for a four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fab service”
Reviews.Author: billybobVictoria
Reviews.Content: have been meaning to write this review for ages, we stay at the sebel pier one every year when we go to sydney for work, this year we were given a room on the first floor, with no access to outside, which was the first time, i suffer from mild claustrophobia, so asked if we could be moved. the front desk explained that as the hotel was booked out there was no=thing they could do that night but would move us tommorrow. we were upgraded to a ground floor suite with courtyard at no extra cost. we usually use our time in sydney to catch up on sydney restaurants but this tiime decided to eat at the sebel and it was fantastic, the service excellent and the food really first class. with such an amazing position, this would be one of my favourite hotels anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located and good value”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandMich
Reviews.Content: The Sebel Pier One is a great choice for affordable accommodation close to all the action in Sydney. It has a very priviledged position capturing the evening sun right at the foot of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, right amongst the cafes, restaurants and markets of the surrounding Sydney Rocks area. The hotel is built into a converted old wharf shed which must have had its challenges, but enough of the historic features have been preserved to make staying here much more interesting than most hotels. The rooms are well fitted out with excellent beds, linen and some art on the walls. The rooms are very good for the price and star rating, at the upper end for this type of hotel. I have stayed here twice and it is firmly my hotel of choice in Sydney and is fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A superb Sydney hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carl0086
Reviews.Content: I spent several days here while exploring Sydney and you couldn't ask for a better hotel in terms of location, quality, or service. It's right in the heart of the Rocks and an easy walk to the ferry terminal and the opera house. You can walk to plenty of shops, restaurants, museums, and the Sydney Observatory. In addition, the Sydney Explorer bus has a stop nearby for exploring the rest of the city. You are right next to the Harbour Bridge and you could see the climbers beginning their ascent from my room. The room was not huge, but a good size and was very clean and had excellent amenities. The staff was friendly and gracious at all levels. There were computers available to guests that offered free Internet service as well. I will definitely stay here when I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff, and a world class backdrop, I'd definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob7005b
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Sydney during our time in Australia. It was our first time in Sydney and we chose the hotel primarily because of it's quirky look. After taking the shared bus service from the airport we thought we had made the wrong choice as everyone else got out at hotels around darling harbour. We were concerned that we would be out of the way at this hotel. We were wrong. The hotel is just underneath the Harbour Bridge. A very short walk along the water front takes you to wonderful views of the Opera House and a quirky, trendy and historic area of Sydney, The Rocks. The Rocks is a fantastic place to be, full of lovely period architectue, great place to eat and, of course, a fantastic backdrop. With this on it's doorstep, location is a big plus for this hotel. The hotel's lobby is light and opens out on to the water front. A very slight criticism is that the much vaunted glass floor isnot in the best of condition. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were clean, spacious, attractive and up to date with well presented bathrooms. Room servicing was good. Other reviews complain about the loud toilets and while the flush certainly was powerful (like those on an airoverly intrusiveline), the noise was not intrusive. However there was some noise from above rooms which could be overheard and while it didn't distract from my stay, a particularly noisy resident above you could be problematic. All in all the hotel's main attraction is it's location. It's a comfortable place to stay but few hotels around the world have such a fanatstic backdrop and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “met and exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: luckeyus
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to the Sebel for their location which is beyond what we envisionsed. We were happy we stayed due to the service of the staff. The view of and from the south east pylon on the sydney bridge was quite special. The room was comfertable with nice hot water caref for instant tea coffee

Reviews.Title: “Sebel Pier one was perfect”
Reviews.Author: CottonWoolOz
Reviews.Content: As Sydneysiders requiring a 2 night stay in our own city, we chose Sebel Pier One for several reasons. Position and Price being key. The position of Pier One is excellent. Waterfront and almost 'under' the Sydney Harbour Bridge, we had a heritage room facing West and could see lots of action on Sydney Harbour. A 5 minute level stroll to The Rocks and Circular Quay. Though we chose a couple of little cafes along Walsh Bay wharves for breakfast each day, we ate in the hotel restaurant on our first night and couldn't have been happier with the food or service. The position again over the water was lovely and even watched a vicious thunderstorm roll up the harbour. The rooms were spotless, lovely bathrooms, and with the whole building being a converted wharf, the exceptionally high ceilings and huge timber trusses add beautiful character. Would we stay at Sebel Pier One again? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: DavlynDerbyshireUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel at the beginning of our tour. We found it to be in a great position - and it was lovely to eat out on the water's edge. We arrived after an overnight flight at 7am and the staff were extremely helpful, found us a guest room in which to have a shower and store our bags before we went exploring. Rooms most unusual because of the conversion but modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value good location a bit quirky but fine”
Reviews.Author: yiannis93101
Reviews.Content: just returned from a couple nights in sydney and this was the host hotel for our company event. didn't know of it when i left the states but upon arrival found it to be just fine. the check in staff was pleasant, not overly so, but going thru the motions and were not rude whatsoever. the hotel seems to carry on with a "W" hotel style, perhaps trying to be hip, traditional, and whatever all at the same time still trying to find it's own unique balance. my room 141 was fine altho there was no view at all and it was somewhat dark. so, you turn the lights on or raise the curtain. only thing i did not like was the glass countertops in the bathroom. the way it's designed, water somehow seems to splash out of the wash bowl and onto every surface. i finally moved all my products to the shelf below so nothing would get wet. they had low-flow shower heads on, but hey, there is a water shortage in parts of OZ so they should have low flow. for anyone who has been on any newer cruise ship, the loo flushing with a whoooshing sound, high pressure for sure. oh well, at least it gets the job done! but it didn't bother me at night to hear it from adjacent rooms. perhaps if you were a light sleeper, you would be bothered. food service was good. we had one meeting in their small meeting room where breakfast was provided. also had easter sunday brunch there and all items were very good. staff seemed to have trouble keeping up with keeping items on the buffet line but hey, it was easter and they were busy. all in all, i'd say a good hotel for the money. not a "W" not a four seasons and not the hyatt but certainly a great location for those who can walk a bit and don't mind being at the most a 5 or max 10 min walk from circular quay, clean and good feel to it as well. would i stay again, yes.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain considering the location!”
Reviews.Author: suefromCalif
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be close to Circular Quay for a change but didn't want to spend a fortune. Found this hotel just around the corner from the Sydney Harbor Bridge on Walsh Bay. Used to be commercial wharves and now remodeled to a hotel, condos, restaurants, theatre, coffee houses etc. The lobby is spectacular with a view right over the water- the Harbor Bridge to the right and Darling Harbor to the left. Only complaints are that the hallways are unbearably hot and the toilets flush loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Unhygienic place - terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Anita021
Reviews.Content: We booked the romantic getaway the Walsh Bay Suite, with a Spa Bath . Cleaner didn't bother to provide clean towels. The champagne glasses were dirty as well. Annoying noise on the floor and room . Unfriendly staff, however very nice choice for breakfast in buffet. They pretend to be a 4.5 stars hotel it a maximum three stars. If you are looking for something special I would recommend [-] itâ€™s in Hunter Valley . Anne

Reviews.Title: “great location,lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagittarius7Middx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on the bay,near Circular Quay and The Rocks.The staff were very friendly and the service was very good.The girl on reception brought up my luggage herself because the concierge was busy.The restaurant and bar staff were very helpful and friendly ,particuarly as I was on my own they made me feel very welcome and sitting on the bar deck with a drink watching the boats was just bliss. Specials at the bar and restaurant are a very good deal. The room was nicely appointed and comfortable with tea/coffee making facilities. Choice of Newspapers and they are are complimentary.The only downside was that the being a Heritage room in a converted wharf the window was a bit small and because it was partly overlooked it was necessary to keep the (transparent) blind down on occasions.I thought the soundproofing was good.I got a good price deal on a website so overall I had a great time and the location is just perfect. I felt it was more than good value for what I paid.Personally I was not at all bothered by the toilets!! I'm more concerned with good staff and a prime central location which this certainly was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over priced”
Reviews.Author: TashSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days after our wedding, and while the view was great, and the rooms nice (the daybeds by the window are a great touch!) I don't feel it's worth the money. Service is pretty average given the price range and there are two things that really bug me about hotels (I know that I shouldn't be concerned about these during my honeymoon but I can't help myself) 1. Overpriced internet - When you are paying that much money for a room, you should be able to check your email without reaching for your credit card. 2. TV aspect ratio - There was a nice big widescreen LCD TV in the room, but that means jack because the footage is oldschool 4:3 with the top and bottom chopped off. This is so dumb and yet surprisingly common amongst fancy hotels, they replace the TV but not the system behind it.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaulley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks in November/December 2008 and stayed in one of the king waterside rooms for our first wedding anniversary. We have stayed in Sydney on previous occasions as my sister now lives there and will visit again but would not return to this hotel. We did not feel the hotel lives up to its four and a half star rating and the level of service was poor. During the first couple of days of our stay there was a problem with our air conditioning so we contacted reception. We were informed that they would send someone up from maintenance the next day however when we returned the following evening no one had been to have a look and there was no record of any problem. Eventually, someone was sent to check on the system which was fixed temporarily then broke down again. As a result we were informed by the hotel that we would need to move rooms and pack up all our things. Although we appreciate things can go wrong we had expected an apology at least for the inconvenience it caused us having to re pack and then unpack our suitcases but this was not forthcoming . Our stay was also booked to include breakfast but nearly every morning at breakfast the staff implied it was not even though we had spoken to reception on two previous occasions to confirm this. We also hired a car for a day during our stay and were told by the hotel staff to leave it outside the hotel for the hire staff to collect. No mention was made of any car park charges until we were given the bill at the end of our stay. Overall we also felt the hotel was geared up for wedding and business functions and not for individual holidays. During the weekends the hotel bar was packed full of wedding guests and we felt that we were intruding on them. There was also nowhere to sit and we had a job to get to the bar despite the fact we were staying at the hotel. We would not recommend this hotel and it was certainly not worth the money we paid for our stay! l

Reviews.Title: “Dog Day Afternoon”
Reviews.Author: lehou1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel for its fantastic central location, and, it now accepts pets. We had a ground floor room with direct access to the pier on Walsh Bay. The floor to ceiling view was great. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, and everything worked. Apart from the fear of sitting on the airline style toilet ( I though I was going to be sucked into the harbour) the facilities where of a high standard. Staff were very friendly and attentive when you could find them. We must be in a recession. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend the accomodation to any pet lover. The room service breakfast was great, but they kept forgeting to supply basic condiments like salt pepper and sugar. The dog facilities includes an off the floor bed with a clean donna. An immaculate dog bowl, and a squeeky toy which the dog was allowed to take home as a momento. At $300 a night.. what the heck, you can't take it with you!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay again!”
Reviews.Author: jayjayy
Reviews.Content: This hotel didnt quite live up to my expectations. When we arrived it took 10 minutes till somebody strolled over and directed us to the reception desk. There was no one to take our luggage to the room. They couldnt find our reservation for quite a while there even though i had rang earlier that afternoon to confirm. There was a huge cockroach on the front desk which wouldnt have bothered me so much if everything else had been okay. Now to the room.. decently sized but there were a few attention to detail issues... The mirror in the bathroom was dirty as was the bath tub, the telephone and TV were broken, i had to go down and get somebody to come up to fix them. The champagne and the chocolate that were supposed to be in the room weren't. All the staff were great and the food was magnificent (dinner and breakfast... esp the dinner) Just a shame the attention to detail was lacking... for the amount of money it costs to stay there it just all feels a little too sloppy.
