And the toilets are a shocker but every other reviewer mentions them in detail so i think i will leave it at that. The views are amazing, the hotel has some real potential but....

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sarasponda
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. I did lots of research to fine the best rate and hotel. We settled on the Pier One since it was right on the water. After a grueling 16 hour flight, we arrived at the hotel. The first room we were given (because it was ready for occupancy) was not the one we ordered and paid for. It was on the 3rd floor and only a tiny high window which did not open. We asked for the room we paid for and were changed to a wonderful ground floor suite with two sliding doors. It had a nice table and chairs on the lanai and we had our evening wine and cheese time there nearly every night. We were able to watch the boats on the very busy harbor. It was right on the water with a promenade for public use. We found this to be great, since we got to talk to some of the various folks as they were passing by,and they were all very nice and interesting. Since we were to be staying for two weeks, this room was very comfortable and all was well. The staff in the hotel were very nice, polite, friendly, and most accommodating. The hotel was within a good walking distance to everything and we walked at least five miles a day. The ferry system is great and a good way to venture around and not expensive at all. We loved our time at the Sebel and would certainly stay again and would not hesitate to recommend this fine property to anyone needing peace and quiet as well as the hustle and bustle of people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, I walked away from the experience extremely disappointed and would stro”
Reviews.Author: jean070
Reviews.Content: Overall, I walked away from the experience extremely disappointed and would strongly discourage any intending guests to reconsider selecting the Sebel as their choice of accommodation.The breakfast ,food and service was terrible. Dinner in the restaurant was disapointing,I thought the food was ordinary ,not sure if they have a chef.I thoght my dinner was prepared by a houewife not a professional chef. Please stay away form this Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for something different”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work for two nights. The hotel is in an amazing location right on the water (over the water) and next to the Harbour Bridge. The decor of the hotel is nice and modern with some cool touches such as a glass floor near the lounge area to look through to the water below and modern touch sensative lifts however which were annoying to work out how to use at first. The toilet is noisy due to vacuum flush (similar to an aeroplane) and due to the floorboards in the hall it's very noisy when people walk past. The view was of the wharf next to us so it wasn't harbour views or anything amazing. It was different and an interesting place to stay but I don't know that I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “more like a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: drconc
Reviews.Content: I booked a 'Romantic Getaway' experience that included a bottle of sparkling wine on arrival a box of chocolates and a Bvalgari gift pack - sounds wonderful? Well, I arrived in my KING room to find a speactular view ....if you stand on your tippy toes and squint your eyes out of the hazzy small window. I looked up and down and all around for my 'Romantic' stuff ...and it was nowhere to be found. The room looked more like a Joker size than a King and the toilet sounded like it was about to take-off when you flushed it but it was the wonderful chocolate and wine that awaited me in my room that made my arrival worth it ....ooh thats right THERE WAS NO WINE OR CHOCOLATES ON ARRIVAL!!!!!!!!!!!! So, on my way down to the lobby I politley reminded them of my package and they said "Oh yes! It's all on the way", so my partner and I went out only to come home hours later and still find no special package awaiting us. We showered (and brought our own soap ...for some reason 5 star hotels can only afford the classic stinky hotel soap which is lovely if you want to stink like scratchy hotel soap) and we went out to dinner we arrived back at the hotel very late to find that there was no wine or chocolates or gift packs and went to bed in our lusciously hard uncomfortable stained 5 star bed. We awoke and got ready to enjoy our buffet breakfast only to be told to sit and wait for a table to be ready ....the breakfast was delicious - if you like old fried eggs mmmmmm. After breakfast, I then went to reception to advise them of my disappointment with my 'Romatic Getway' package only to have the receptionist bring out a form where my name was highlighted and signed to say that the package had been delivered??? So there may be a number of the Sebels staff stammering around with a bit of extra wine to enjoy and chocolates smothered over their mouths smelling like Bvalgari perfume .....anyway I was offered the wine which I knidly declined because I just didn't feel like drinking it a 10am and seeing that I only stayed the one night I didn't feel like drinking it during the day either - did I want extra lugguage? No, thank you. I was also offered an extended check-out uuumm no thank you ...I can only stand on my tippy toes for so long staring out the window with the view of the harbour. All in all ...for a 5 star hotel it was disgraceful and I am terrified of the amount I spent for one night in a room with a flying toilet a hard bed that cracks your back and detaches your shoulders and no delivery on promised packages - $405.00??? Minus the $400.00 and then we would have had a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average service”
Reviews.Author: Ollieboard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location, sitting on Sydney Harbour and close to the Rocks and Darling Harbour etc. This proximity to what's good about Sydney to some extent makes up for the Sebel Pier One's shortcomings in service in the areas of the car valet service, housekeeping, and restaurant staff. During our short stay the service in the restaurant was very slow with the staff inattentative and failing to respond to requests for service. In the end we tired of waiting and went to the bar to get our own drinks. Similarly, a request for towels from housekeeping staff was ignored. We were also concerned that the airconditioning controls, radio station and side mirrors of our car - left overnight at the Sebel's parking lot - had been altered by valet staff. We did complain about the car (only) and the Duty Manager advised that he would investigate the matter on our behalf. Because the hotel is literally sitting on the harbour we booked a waterview room. A word of warning to future travellers - the window in the Heritage room we had on level one was so high that you had to be standing directly in front of the window to see the water - very difficult for short people. Only the sky is visible when you walk around the room or sit down in front of the window. Unsure if this is because the pier is listed as a historic building and basic structure of the building cannot be altered. The rooms on level two have full size windows so presumably they would afford a better waterview. We will try a different hotel on the next short break in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sebel Pier One - The Sinking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin123Sydney
Reviews.Content: I recently had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Sebel Pier One (Sydney) on a business trip. Unfortunately, I have very little to add in the way of positive feedback as my experience was nothing short of abysmal. The Sebel appears to have serious defects in its plumbing system. Rooms on the second floor of the hotel were flooded as a result of recent rainfalls. One colleague even had what appeared to be sewerage spilling out from a drain in the bathroom! I was awoken very early one morning to loud screaming. As it turned out, one of the guests had been electrocuted from the hairdryer. I am also aware of other guests (including myself) being electrocuted from the applicances. The hotel rooms were small and oddly shaped. Whilst they were well appointed, the state of the fittings was poor. In one particular case a guest reported that the shelves in her wardrobe had been held together with masking tape and when she opened the cupboard doors all the shelves collapsed! I found that the conference rooms themselves were ill-equipped for business conferences - airconditioning was inconsistent and the accoustics appauling. This seemingly endless series of unfortunate events was promtly brought to the attention of hotel staff who simply chose to ignore the complaints that were made or were at times hostile in their response. . Overall, I walked away from the experience extremely disappointed and would strongly discourage any intending guests to reconsider selecting the Sebel as their choice of accommodation. Sebel Pier One has some serious structural flaws which should be addressed urgently otherwise it will only be a matter of time before someone is seriously injured. In addition, the staff should be more responsive to any complaints that are made rather than choosing to ignore them or view them as comical.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: duchess_bvlgari
Reviews.Content: I thought I would surprise my then fiance with a weekend trip to Sydney and chose Pier One for its location. Being right on the water, I thought it would be hard to beat. Staff were friendly and we checked into our Walsh Bay Suite. The room was cute, with great views and the bed was comfortable enough. HOWEVER, at night, the pipes were loud and we knew exactly when the guests in the room above us were bathing or going to toilet and unfortunately we also knew exactly what they were doing in the toilet. On our last morning whilst we had breakfast in our room, I rested my leg on one of the dining chairs and there was a sharp nail lying in the padded upholstery which pierced me. We reported the the matter to reception when we checked and the girl was horrified. Hopefully, the replaced the chair! I would recommend the hotel as somewhere to stay if it weren't for the constant noise coming from the pipes, unfortunately I don't think it's something that can be easily rectified. For those of you looking for a true Five Star Experience, book yourself into the Observatory or Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “No No No! Was Expecting so much more!”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: I searched for weeks for somewhere special for hubby and I to stay for one night in Sydney (a Sat night). I would never stay here again and am so dissapointed with the property and the service. Check in: Arrived at 7pm from our flight. No concierge waiting to take our luggage. 2 very unfriendly people sitting down behind the desk at reception. The man was quite rude in his manner and was not at all welcoming. Given room key...filled out forms and gave CC. Was asked for drivers licence as apparantly a lot of fraud has been happening in Sydney! When i questioned why he wanted my licence he rudely gave me the above answer. Room: We paid for a King Harbour View Room. The window was tiny and i would have had to stand on a chair to get to see out of the window it was that high up. Corridors have seen better days..looked tired and grimy handprints on the steel like doors. Small room for aussie sizes...especially for a King room. Standard sized bathroom and facilities. Bathtub was a little old. Stainless steel sink is exactly like an airline toilet sink as is the toilet (well the sound when you press the button anyway!!) Room had fairly dim lighting. Comfy pillows, though a couple of oldish stains in the sheets and small tears. Flat screen TV with the basic Cable channels as well as pay to view movies. Breakfast: We paid full price for breakfast at $36 each for buffet. Usual selections of food, however no made to order eggs which is poor for the price. Lobby: Hotel lobby was fairly bright and bustling on morning of check out. Better vibe than the previous night. The location is good. 5 mins walk to The Rocks. You can see the people walking on the Bridge from outside the hotel. The water view from the breakfast view is pleasant on a nice day. I wouldnt stay again. The price i paid was for 5 star hotels..and this is barely a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Petal57
Reviews.Content: We were debating whether to stay at this Hotel because of the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor. We were very glad that we did. On arrival, we were upgraded to a King water view room. It was sensational! There was a whole roof to floor wall sized view of Walsh Bay and beyond. The area is less populated and quieter than Circular Quay and you feel that you are right on the water- which you are. The Rocks area is adjacent, which is perfect for exploring and dining in very reasonably priced restaurants. The bed was one of the most comfortable Hotel beds I have slept in, and room service food was better quality than most. The bathroom was modern and well appointed. Overall, we loved it- and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to get home”
Reviews.Author: MEEEEE_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and it was very disappointing. There were several problems including: the bathroom flooded with sea water (problem with plumbing) and no apology was giving or offer to relocate to another room, rude staff and poor service, the quality of the food was very inconsistent. The room was very average, not very spacious, small window with no view, noisy room (including plane style toilet), the aircon did not work properly and the ceiling leaked when it rained. Overall it was not what I expected from a hotel with a good rating. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would actively discourage people who are thinking of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: JCinAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our vacation in Sydney. The hotel is beautiful on the interior as well as the exterior. The staff was nice and helpful. The room overlooked the harbour...so it was a great view. The bed was very comfortable and it was pretty quiet in the room at night. The only 2 problems that we encountered were: 1) There is a drain in the middle of the bathroom. On our first night, the neighboring room flushed their toilet (yes, I could hear that while I was standing in the bathroom, but I was aware of this already) and when they did, the smell of sewage or some really rotten smell came from that drain. My husband said that the drain might be dry, so he poured some water in it and the smell finally went away. We should have called the front desk about it, I know, but we were exhausted from a flight and just wanted to rest. 2) I saw a roach one night in the bathroom. However, I didn't complain because I realized that this hotel sits right on the water and that comes with the territory. But, I just wanted to mention that. Overall, it was a good value of a hotel to be located where it was, which is right under the bridge. We were able to walk to George St and Circular Quay really quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nerekdart
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about 6 times and always book here when visiting Sydney for work - if I can get a good rate on wotif. I love the location - the walk along the Quay and the Rocks to get the hotel after a day in the office. I hate pokey, fenced in, dark hotel rooms - and this is definitely not the Sebel. I like the blue and white furnishings. There is a feeling of corporate mixed with nautical. The hotel isn't massive and quite personal. I've never had a noisy room - although their toilets can be a little noisy. The beds are fantastic and very comfy. The outlook of all rooms I've had has been the water or the bridge/sandstone. Prices in outlets are reasonable. The lobby bar sitting out waterside is a great place to have a sundowner after work. Concierge here is fantastic. Reception is always efficient but I find them a little on the cold side. I feel like I can really relax here after a days work and not get hassled by hotel staff/lift noises/party goers and the like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the outer Rocks area”
Reviews.Author: golfEngland
Reviews.Content: Judging by the most recent reviews it seems like this hotel is getting their act together. We were concerned having booked at the Sebel Pier for the start of our Oz trip and then reviewing previous postings on trip advisor stating discourteous staff, dirty rooms etc failed to materialize. Needing an early check in we didn't hold out much hope but were pleasantly surprised to find our room available at 8.30 in the morning. The room was clean, spacious, high cathedral ceilings (ask for top floor/waterview room) with excellent views over the bay and North Sydney. One or two of the rooms have a large terrace for the smokers out there, but I imagine these are at a supplement but ask anyway. Prices for food and drink are what you would expect from the star rating and a little overpriced, but on a nice day sitting on the quayside with a beer and butty, very relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tatchull
Reviews.Content: My other half and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights when we were in Sydney for a wedding. It is in a wonderful location (under the harbour bridge), and everything about it is of a very high standard. The staff were great, the room was great, the bed was great, I loved it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: nbydeley
Reviews.Content: While being on the waterfront was nice, we found this hotel to be awfully expensive and really not worth the $350/night. Much nicer and more modern hotels can be found in Sydney CBD, with better locations for walking in the city in general. We stayed at the Swissotel for the remainder of the time and loved it! We also got charged a huge amount for the breakfast buffet here ($60AUS for 2!) after being told when we checked in that it would be included in our price. It was not and we were charged this amount after checking out, a real rip off! Staff was nice and friendly and the one dinner we had here was outstanding, but that was about it to this place. Also, in the rooms, you couldn't open your window, which would have been nice for waterfront rooms - that's why you get one right? :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kris_Brazil08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot if you're after somewhere in the historic Rocks area. I stayed at the Sebel the night before my wedding and stayed in a Walsh Bay Suite. The suite is a lovely option with a bay window type window that overlooks the bay. The suite has a Kind Bed which can be separated from the rest of the living area (sliding doors). The living area had a double fold-out sofa bed and a massive plasma tv on the wall. The bathroom was very large, with a spa-type bath and a big shower. There were also two sinks (good for brides-maids to get ready). The only bad thing about the hotel was the noise that came from the pipes and the toilet. The first time I flushed the toilet I thought I was going to be sucked away with it! You should have seen the fright my poor 4 year old nephew had when he used it, he cried it scared him so much! And you can hear when surrounding rooms flush their toilets too. Which is not so good if you're a light sleeper. I'd suggest taking ear plugs! Overall, very happy with the hotel. Although, I had requested the room not to be made-up after getting ready for the wedding and had also left the do-not-disturb sign on the door and they cleaned the room anyway, which I wasn't happy about. I'd also recommend not ringing reservations but booking direct on their website - with advance notice you are able to get a better rate on their own website rather than using other on-line/last minute websites - just book in advance and you should be able to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: jmsenger
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here over New Year's. The location is great, right on the water and an easy walk to the rest of the Rocks, Opera House, etc. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, but the housekeeping was not. We had a big problem with housekeeping hanging a "Do Not Disturb" tag on our door to avoid having to clean the room several days. It was only after complaining to the manager that they stopped doing this. The concierge was generally pretty helpful for the small things, but when we needed something major - a way to get to the Opera House on NYE without having to walk in our black-tie outfits - he was useless. The idea to call a water taxi came from someone else. The food and drinks were decent, the room was good too, if a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Sebel”
Reviews.Author: KKATZ_8
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved The Sebel Pier One. Great location and service was excellent! It's a very unique hotel and the lobby and it's glass floor are gorgeous. We stayed in a waterside room which had lovely views of the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: GucciSydney
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just spent our 10th wedding anniversay at The Sebel Pier One and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful and service was great. We were truly spoilt and will definitley be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: zerogeewhiz
Reviews.Content: We were given a night at Pier One as a gift so we probably shouldn't grumble that much....but... This is possibly one of the noisiest hotels I've ever stayed in. The racket from the vacuum toilets is incredible and all night all you could hear was 'whoosh' as people flushed. One hopes one wouldn't be stuck there with a tummy bug running around or it would be one long whoosh. The rooms are of average size and furnished with an odd, over-stuffed armchair in the King Room overlooking Walsh Bay. Being a heritage-listed site, the design is severely compromised, with windows in weird places. Of course, you can't beat the location, especially if you're planning a night to see either a Sydney Theatre Company or Sydney Dance Company production. Although the $25 parking charge is obscene, it's just a cage on the other side of the road, open to the elements and the yoofs that frequent the area. The restaurant is okay, but like most central Sydney restaurants is fabulously over-priced for what you get. We didn't make it in time for the buffet breakfast but by all accounts it is reasonably pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't rush back”
Reviews.Author: jacs1261
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebel Pier One in Oct 2007 and must say I wouldn't rush back there. Our room size was average but the window ledge was so wide you had to just about crawl up to close the curtains (thank goodness for a husband with long arms). There was no extractor fan in the bathroom so whenever you had a shower the whole room steamed up. The mirror in the bathroom was not cleaned the entire time we were there which was evident by the writing that you could see on it when the mirror steamed up (left by the previous occupants or the ones before them!!!). Every time someone (probably from rooms above us) flushed their toilet you get hear it & everytime we flushed our toilet, the bathroom door would open. The mini fridge had the piece that holds things in place in the door missing so everytime you opened the fridge everything that was in the door fell out. The bed was king size & really firm, but we like a firm bed so that was not a problem for us. On the plus side it was within easy walking distance of Circular Quay & had great views, but then again you don't need to stay in the hotel to get the spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayshaben
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after attending a wedding. Lovely spacious rooms, great service, breakfast buffet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: After paying over $400 for a king room overlooking Walsh Bay (NOT including breakfast, parking or late checkout), we were very disappointed to find our room was directly above a function area and we were forced to listen to loud music and guests talking and laughing until after 11.30 pm. We had hoped to have a reasonably early night but it was not to be. The room itself was a good size but mediocre apart from the bathroom which was quite nice with two sinks, spa and plenty of fluffy towels. The bed was comfortable but not worth the money and the Sebel Pier One will not be on our "revisit" list.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HOTELIERShrewsbury
Reviews.Content: We were on a two month tour (Dubai/NZ/Oz/Malaysia) and have to say for the price paid (the most expensive hotel on our trip inc 5* in Dubai, and Malaysia e.g The Datai), the Sebel Pier One was the most disappointing of the hotels in which we stayed. From the initial room (a "harbour view" for which a supplement was paid) all we saw was a former metal crane; upgraded to a suite (after a fuss, at no extra cost) with traffic flowing passed one of the windows! The trains we expected, but not a busy main road with less-than-effective double glazing. Breakfast somewhat of a disaster with no real management; ran out of coffee, cold items etc. Charged for internet usage - in this day and age! Despite a Formal Complaint before departure, a month on there has been no feed back from the hotel. Sorry, but we will definitely NOT be returning nor recommending. This by a hotelier of 40 years standing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: briongloid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in September this year. Unfortunately our visit to Syndney collided with the APEC conference which meant that security in the city was high. We found hotel staff to be friendly and courteous. We were able to check in to our room at 10am. The room was lovely and had character which is often lacking in modern hotels. Friends of ours were also staying in the hotel at the time and a visit to their room indicated that we had been lucky. Their room was much smaller than ours with hardly room to walk around the bed. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was quite expensive but had no trouble finding alternative places to eat. Check out was quick and overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Shame about Some Staff”
Reviews.Author: Songbird H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while visiting Sydney, the hotel is lovely and the room was really clean and comfortable. I had a few problems with two members of staff, first of all I had requested a safety deposit box at reception, the manager was called twice in 20 minutes to arrange this for me, after 30 minutes he/she did'nt show up and as we had to be somewhere i cancelled my request. I thought this was bad service as I had some important documents and jewellery to be kept safe, in the end I locked them in my suitcase and hoped for the best. Secondly, I could'nt believe way we were treated at check out, it was rather early 5am, but this is no excuse for bad manners, the man at reception made up our bill and asked us for the money with no please, thank you or have a nice day, I could'nt believe it, I felt like asking him did manners not kick in to 9am, but instead I will write to his Manager, it left a bad taste in our mouth about this hotel and our memories of Sydney. On a posititive note, our waitress on the night we had dinner was lovely and could'nt do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not Going back!”
Reviews.Author: Warrens_of_Conder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel on the 6th of October 2007. As it was a special day for us (our 11th Wedding Anniversary) we opted for a Walsh Bay Suite. First impressions of the hotel were good, valet parking was excellent and all the staff that we came into contact with were pleasant, polite and helpful. Then we went to our room. The hotels web site photo gallery of this type of room is no indication of the room. On entering the room the bathroom smelt terrible, a real sewage type smell and unpleasant. There were numerous cracked, broken, dirty and missing tiles, the toilet paper roll holder was hanging off, hair on the floor and the shower dribbled instead of showered and leaked over the bathroom floor when in use making the bathroom floor slippery. The room was supposed to have a day bed, it didnt, the windows were supposed to open fully, they didint (and had broken galss in the window) and the air conditioning was totally ineffective. The furniture had VERY obvious stains on it as did the pillow case on the bed. The room was very noisy and we were even woken at 2am by staff cleaning up after a wedding discussing the 'attributes' of female guests. At $385 + $25 parking + $66 for breakfast this hotel is way below standard. We wont be back!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: koala2
Reviews.Content: In desperate need of a major refurbishment, this Hotel is let down badly by its poor Housekeeping & Service standards. My room was on the 1st level overlooking Hickson St. & was dark, dingy & very tired. The room's unique architectural features of heavy timber beams & large steel trusses (from the original conversion from a historic waterfront Warehouse) make for an interesting change, but not when they are covered in 2cms. of thick dust!! The Hotel staff were young & inexperienced, lacking the polish I would have expected from a Hotel of this calibre. They seemed stressed, overworked & unsupervised for the duration of my stay. This should be a fantastic establishment, considering its location & heritage, but the Mirvac Group need to get their act together in a big way & make a commitment to restoring this Hotel to its rightful place as one of Sydney's finest.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Bea8
Reviews.Content: I was under the impression this was a 5 star hotel on Sydney harbour with amazing views... well ,I was wrong. The room was tiny, with a window the size of a show box - no view at all, in fact it felt like being in a basement. The room was not as clean as you would expect in a 5 star hotel. Scuff marks on the walls ect. However, the breakfast was fantastic. We decided to pay the extra $$ to upgrade to the suite - luckily we took a look first and it was just as awful. This hotel is in dire need of a refurb. Not a bad hotel but dont expect 5 star. I would give it 4 at a push.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and lovely Sebel Pier One Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Katgalmusic
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely, immaculate hotel, overlooking the waters of Sydney Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Love Sebel Pier One”
Reviews.Author: ALJones
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice (first time on our honeymoon, second on our wedding anniversary) and both times have been excellent. It's great in terms of location and value for money (considering other hotels of the same quality in the vicinity). We had our room upgraded to a room with a view over Walsh bay which was great. The rooms are spacious and of a very high standard and staff very freindly. Location is about 10 mins walk to circular quay, 5 mins to the Rocks area. Worth telling them if it's a special occasion. We got a lovely bottle of champagne (decent stuff!) in our room on our anniversary and also a card from the managment with a comment welcoming us back. Really nice touch. The only frustration was that the bar closed early (around 11ish) and we weren't able to get a drink having returned from dining out. Apart from that I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: annemarienz
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel badly let down by the housekeeping service. When I arrived, the first room I was shown to, on the ground floor, had a broken blind leaving the room open to the boardwalk and people strolling back and forth right outside. The staff very kindly swiftly moved us to another room on the 3rd floor which was spacious with high ceilings and overlooked Walsh Bay. The staff we encountered (room service, front desk, bar staff) were exceptional. The slightly odd and noisy plumbing was slightly irritating but certainly not enough to put us off the hotel. Unfortunately the whole experience was marred by the terrible housekeeping service. Day one (we stayed for 4 nights), the room was cleaned adequately but not to a standard you would expect from a hotel of this level. Day two, I requested a change of sheets (request required in keeping with hotel's green policy) as there was a hole in one of the sheets. When we returned in the evening the bed was made to look like there were clean sheets but discovered the exact same hole in the sheet when I went to bed. Nothing else was cleaned in the room, bin were not emptied, drawers left open, toiletries/glasses/washcloths not refreshed and the towels left on the floor for replacement were still there. Day three the room was not touched at all - unfortunately we returned too late in the evening from our day out to raise it with the front desk. While 1-2 day sheets and towels can't be considered a hardship, it is certainly not what you expect from a 4-5 star hotel. While the hotel itself really was lovely and was nice to stay out of the CBD but still in easy reach of the city, the housekeeping experience has put me off returning to this hotel or any other in the Sebel/Mirvac chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the weddings!”
Reviews.Author: Dave Clarke
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location but beware the weddings!! This is a great hotel nestled under the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the Rocks area of the City. We stayed for 6 nights from the 20 March and when we arrived were upgrared to a great large room at the end of the hotel building (Room 341) farthest away from the water (but this was also farthest away from the function suites which was great see comment on the number of events and weddings at the hotel below in this review). Large room and bathroom but was in need of a little good housekeeping (a vac around some of the funiture legs would have removed the dust rings (Hotel management if you read this, you check the dust out near the furniture! Great bar but slow staff, very slow in the morning as we waited for 15 minutes for two expresso's! Perhaps we are just used to the speed of life in North America and London? (also we had to return a glass of wine that had some lipstick on the rim and had not been cleaned properly). Check out the number of weddings at the hotel - lots and the guests hog the bar and mean that residents cannot get at the bar or enjoy a nice drink in peace! This spoils it a little as the water front is superb. If you do stop don't bother with break fast, just turn right out of the hotel main door and head in the direction of Darling Harbour, a 10 minute (if not less) walk past the dance School and inward to the water front beside the loft apartments in a great cafe that does superb food and coffee a real find!! mix with the locals is my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “The only really good part was the location.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPlatypus
Reviews.Content: The Sebel Pier One is on a pier at "The Rocks" - an excellent location. However, the room we had was tiny and with uncomfortable modern decor that gives the style a bad name. For instance, the platform bed held a thin mattress that was only marginally less firm than the floor, and there was only a small table and a narrow counter type piece of furniture (which held the TV, telephone, stationery, etc.) on which to place belongings. The lighting was dim and strange (a large light in the floor?). I won't go into details about the cleanliness (lack of) of the room. The stay would have been acceptable had it not been for the bathroom. Here the designers really excelled at unfunctional design. It was huge...but had NO counter space. The sink drain was very slow and we were going to call the front desk. A little later, there was a loud whoosh and gurgle and it drained. This happened every day. The shower (no tub) was one of those that is open to the rest of the space with only a small drain and lip of tile. It was very slippery, so we wore flip-flops (which travelers should probably do routinely anyway). Of course, the water went into other areas of the bath, including the commode fitting into the floor. Rocking toilets make for an interesting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Puppycatbrisvegas
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel in a great location - just underneath the Harbour Bridge. We could walk to Circular Quay for bus or ferry, up to the Rocks etc. Was lovely being on the harbour and watching the boats go past. Rooms are very spacious with large king size bed. We expected a 5 star hotel to have table service around the bar but this did not and we had to go to the bar for drinks. It is close to a function room and there was a wedding both days we stayed and the bar area was very busy and they ran out of cold glasses - obviously they were not prepared. We had dinner at the restaurant and the service was excellent. 1 meal (out of 4) was cold (a steak) when served but cooked perfectly - all other meals were great. They did not charge us for this meal. Staff were great the whole stay. Don't know if I would stay here again as it would depend on my plans in Sydney and what I wanted to be close to.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: xksb
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed during my stay at Pier One. The hotel was out of the way and not as close to The Quay as they make it out to be. The decor is very dated; balconies non-existent; very noisy. There was no cable, so TV options are limited. Quality of room service also disappointing. This hotel is over-rated and over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis from a busy city”
Reviews.Author: MikeBoulder
Reviews.Content: Sebel Pier 1 is at a perfect location, 10 minute walk to The Rocks and Central Quay, 20 minute walk to the Aquarium and Darling Harbor, and well situated on the harbor near the bridge. Compared to the streets near the hotels in the Central Business District, it was always quiet and refreshing when we got back to the hotel since itâ€™s away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Because the hotel is basically by itself on Pier One, there are no restaurants around (except the hotel restaurant) without a 10 minute walk to the Rocks. Not a big deal for us, but may be for others. The Rocks (a section of Old Sydney) is up a few flights of stairs and uphill slightly. Hot continental breakfast is $29 Australian, or about $22 USD as of this writing. Cold continental is $20 Australian. Itâ€™s quite good, but seems a bit over priced. Hard to eat $22 USD worth of scrambled eggs, sausage, fruit, and bread. The bathroom is nicely done and modern, with a beautiful smoky green glass countertop. However, the bathtub and floor are the slipperiest Iâ€™ve ever encountered. Iâ€™m in my 30s, so any fall shouldnâ€™t be a big deal, but older folks should be very careful. The toilet is mentionable only to the fact that itâ€™s so loud. Itâ€™s air assist, so when you flush it, cover your ears. We had a room on the water side ground floor. Not much of a view, but we didnâ€™t pay very much ($150 USD per night). If the major criteria for a nice place is the view, then you would have been disappointed. For us, the major criteria is clean, quiet, and dark (with curtains closed). This without question fit the bill. I really feel the Sebel Pier 1 is a great bargain, and would not hesitate to stay there again on our next trip. A wonderful oasis from a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kagriff4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sebel Pier One hotel in April 06. Had a superior Water room which overlooked Walsh Bay! Lovely room, very comfortable bed. The bathroom was lovely and large with all that you could wish for. The hotel was very obliging and allowed us to leave our suitcases there while we travelled for a few days and then returned back to the Sebel Pier One. We intend to travel to Sydney again and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Port hole window for 400 bucks”
Reviews.Author: Tamdy
Reviews.Content: We paid for a nice room, we got an ok room (big enough) but with no window. When we booked we were told it would be a view of the harbour faicng Balmain. Sorry we got a port hole window and the staff lied about the other rooms. In the end we had to downgrade to get a view ( no money bacK). We will never go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JSPP
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nites over New Years. Good location. We could walk to the Rocks, Ferries and Darling Harbour. Our room was very clean, faced the bridge with high smaller windows but the lobby had a beautiful view of water as rooms on that side of the building would. We never ate at the resturant (too expensive.} We would stay here again. Staff was very helpful and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up to Sydney Harbour”
Reviews.Author: CLI71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our our honeymoon. Arrived after a long trip at 6am and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. While our room wasn't ready we got full use of the facilities of another room. They then hung on to our bags and we went off for a stroll, Out on the hotel terrace we could see the sun coming up with the harbour bridge right above us. Then a couple more steps and to see the spectacular opera house. The area was perfect, right near all the activities. And a few dollars in a taxi brought u to Darling Harbour for some nice restuarants (try Meat & Wine Company & I Thai). Our room overlooked the who bay and was nice and modern with a big bed. While it wasn't the most plush of places it had a lovely seaside, relaxed feel - perfect! It seemed really popular with all the locals for lunch, drinks etc. We had a fantaistic time and we'll definitely be back. Tip: Book directly yourself it is much cheaper than through a travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrLPN
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend for a conference. The venue is great - fantastic views obviously, and the room just lovely. The conference faciltiies and service was also excellent. I cant comment on the cost - work paid for it, not me! - but the venue was superb...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average”
Reviews.Author: rusmoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights -- for a special occasion -- over a weekend. It was expensive, but really did not deliver great value in our opinion. Why this was average? The room was not made on the day it should have. We left the appropriate sign on the door, but to no avail. We did not get our morning newspaper, and the late night room service was straight from the frozen food section of the supermarket. Small things, but for the price we paid, we expected better.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KullyA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year for 6 days. It is a fairly good location as you are literally right under the Harbour Bridge in The Rocks, however slightly away from the centre of things. There are some lovely restaurants & bars all around, but you have search for them. It is best to set out for dinner early ie 6-7pm, as most restaurants close their doors at 9-10pm. Reservations are recommended. The area along the other piers is being developed into an up & coming place to be. We arrived on 30th at noon, disappointed to find that our room was not yet ready, so instead took ourselves off to get our barings. When our room was ready, it was a modern room, nicely decorated , with large bathroom & view of the underside of the Harbour Bridge. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, which was good if a little pricey. Circular Quay is about a 10-15min walk (depending which way you go), we went along the Harbour front, past the imposing building of the Hyatt Hotel. It is so lovely to see a fully operational Harbour at work. Circular Quay is a busy ferry port taking people across the Harbour to Manly, on short trips to Bondi or for a leisurely afternoon cruise. We decided to do a reckie for a good view point for the New Yearâ€™s Eve fireworks. A friend had recommended Mrs Macquarieâ€™s point. We walked through the Botanical Gardens, looking at the amazing examples of trees, flowers & at the huge bats hanging high above our heads & then exited to get to Mrs Macquarieâ€™s Point. Our vantage point for the fireworks was right opposite the Sydney Opera House with the Harbour Bridge in the background. New Yearâ€™s Eve is such a well organised event in Sydney. We decided we would get to our spot early & take a picnic with us. You can bring you own food but not alcohol, there is food & alcohol available to purchase. We went to the famous department store, David Jones Food Hall to stock up on goodies & then headed to Mrs Macquarieâ€™s Point. If you ever get to go to Sydney over New Year - the fireworks are a MUST! Absolutely unbelievable! From Sebel Pier, you can watch people taking the heady climb up to Harbour Bridge, it looked like a challenge so we decided to conquer our fears & do it too. The climb & induction lasts about 3.5 hours and the views are breathtaking. I was slightly wary of the whole thing but I can assure anyone with any concerns that it is extremely safe & not one bit scary! Other sights to see are the Aquarium - brilliant, Darling Harbour - lots to do & see & great bar called Bungalow 8 - fab food, Oz Tower - great views, Oz Trek - slightly dated but still fun, Opera House Tour - really interesting, Manly Beach - Lovely beach, great eatery called Rib & Rump (If you love your meat this is the place for you!) We would recommend the Sebel Pier One to anyone looking for a good base location. The hotel itself slightly lacks in character & the service was satisfactory but not exceptional.

HotelInfo.Name: Sebel Pier One Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Hickson Road, Walsh Bay, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
